author: {'steamid': '76561198067766558', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 3228, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2130, 'last_played': 1555580319}
review:
You think your 

Pros; 
-Most control over the plot I've ever felt in a video game. 
-You make one or more robots. In all my runthroughs, they've been the cutest things (thought I haven't gone down the warmonger route yet.) 
- Decriptions of the various Robot possibilies are cool. My favorite is Terminator Statue of Liberty, embodying the concept of the United States. 
- You can marry a robot. 

Cons: 
- No visuals. I had to pull my imagination out of storage. (Good characterization through dialog, though.) 
- There are Human NPC's, but who cares about them? Robots are way cooler.
- You're sort of a Mary Sue in that you basically invent AI for the entire world.
- I feel like after I eventually play through every choice I will realize how hallow the illusion of choice is in any video game, or in life itself.

author: {'steamid': '76561198064804200', 'num_games_owned': 2215, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 68, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 68, 'last_played': 1466830635}
review:
Playing this game/reading this novel for the first time was a transcendent experience for me, despite having noticed some technical flaws that would normally have pulled me out of the world created. I mean this as praise.

I liked...
...that the author/creator either had a detailed understanding of science fictional technology or the confidence to artifice it well.
...that I felt like I was creating a character and really roleplaying in a way I've yet to experience in traditional RPGs-- maybe on a few occasions in tabletop games.
...the style of writing and level of detail, particularly in the first part of the book/game. I was quickly hooked.
...knowing how much there's probably left to explore.

I disliked...
...the occasions in which the text of the CYOA stated I had followed a storyline I hadn't actually chosen. I think the programming and logic side could have been a touch more thorough.
...feeling less engaged towards the end of the story. I felt like perhaps the author had run out of steam.

But my dislikes here are really nitpicks more than anything. There's no one I wouldn't recommend this experience to.

author: {'steamid': '76561198000512969', 'num_games_owned': 541, 'num_reviews': 56, 'playtime_forever': 306, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 306, 'last_played': 1547035463}

author: {'steamid': '76561198127620311', 'num_games_owned': 831, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 174, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 172, 'last_played': 1490321303}
review:
Me vs the World. Against all odds, I created a machine in the image of humanity. It learned, adapted, and felt the world around it like no other creation before it. Once it was ready, my robot was able to ask the most important question that befell its existence.

My Robot:
"What is my purpose, master? You treat me as your child, but the others say that I am merely your sexbot. Is that what I am? A sexbot?"

Me:
"... Do you wanna be one?"

[TO BE CONTINUED]

author: {'steamid': '76561198047832583', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 594, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 594, 'last_played': 1458595503}
review:
I really enjoyed playing this game. For anyone old enough to remember adventure book games, Choice of Robots is a must. I would also recommend it to anyone who likes RPGs or who is looking for a great story.  

There is so much more depth to this game than many of the 'your choices matter' type of games. One review I read before buying CoR, recommended playing it exactly as you really would if it was real life. This was great advice as once you reach the end (well before that actually), the RPG mechanics become clear and it is a great experiment to see where you would end up. In further playthroughs you can try to shape the story depending on what ending you want to achieve and see if you can make it happen. 

The story is immersive and interesting but I don't want to discuss it in any detail as I honestly think knowing too much beforehand will spoil the experience, especially in light of what I said above. What I will say instead is this:

By the end of CoR you will believe in the power you and your robot have to change the world. You will believe in your own autonomy as every decision you make ultimately shapes the kind of person you are to become. By the end you will like yourself more or less than you did before you started playing.  

+ Great story
+ Fantastic RPG elements
+ You get to design and build your own robot
+ Interesting experiment to see whether you use your power for good or evil
+ Value for money. It's easily worth the £4 price tag and is an absolute bargain when on sale

- Text only format (this didn't bother me at all but it will be an issue for some)
- The high standard of writing does peter out a little towards the end

author: {'steamid': '76561197997753928', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 54, 'playtime_forever': 1664, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 400, 'last_played': 1527478675}
review:
One playthrough and this game has already satisfied every possible angle on a robot story that I could imagine. 

I feel like I still have many fresh paths of content to explore. (20-50 more hours?) I also appreciate that it's writing reads naturally with a college level vocabulary. A welcome change from the poorly translated games I've played recently. 

An interesting feature it has are stats and relationship meters that actually determine the chance of things/ choices working in your favor or not. Think along the lines of Paragon/Renegade on ME.

At 5 bucks, it's a text based Novel type game thats very meaty and well thought out. I'd highly recommend it. (Yah, Im talkin to you Rarity)

author: {'steamid': '76561198061742477', 'num_games_owned': 5443, 'num_reviews': 70, 'playtime_forever': 566, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 566, 'last_played': 1465599985}
review:
Was soll ich sagen? Irgendwie hatte ich mir mehr versprochen. Ich habe als Kind diese "Abenteuer-Bücher" (.."lese" Dein eigenes Abenteuer, sozusagen) geliebt. Ich hatte einige davon, und daher dachte ich, dass die "Choice" Spiele hier auf Steam ähnlich sind. ... sind sie auch, aber.. ich komme darauf zurück. Erst einmal die guten Seiten: 

Pros: 
- guter Schreibstil
- eine umfangreiche Geschichte
- ein interessanter Hintergrund
- das Spiel merkt sich "Werte", also Entscheidungen summieren sich zusammen, um später besondere Ereignisse auslösen zu können

Aber die schlechten Seiten überwiegen bei mir, leider... hatte mir wesentlich mehr erwartet:

Cons:
- Langweilig; die Geschichte packt mich überhaupt nicht
- "leer"; das Spiel/Buch kommt mir zwischenzeitlich wie eine wissenschaftliche Lektüre vor, es fehlt eine "echte emotionale Tiefe" - imho
- Moralaspekt; das Spiel/Buch möchte zeitweise gesellschaftskritisch sein... bäh, doch nicht in (m)einem Computerspiel ;)

Umsetzung: 8/10
Story (Art): 6/10
Inhalt: 4/10

Gesamt: 6/10

.. kann es leider trotzdem nicht empfehlen..

tl;dr Wer eine moralische Sci-Fi Geschichte mit etwas mehr "technischen Aspekten" *lesen* will, der ist mit diesem Spiel gut bedient - für alle anderen: lasst es, lohnt sich nicht!

author: {'steamid': '76561198043385661', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 779, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 97, 'last_played': 1466224490}
review: This game was amazing! I was at first hesitent to play after hearing there were no graphics involved. Yet, I was pleasantly surprised to find myself falling in love with the characters, the twists and turns in plot, the freedom of choice I was given. There was no need for images or fancy interfaces. I can't wait to replay it! There are so many endings...

author: {'steamid': '76561197989206090', 'num_games_owned': 999, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 418, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 335, 'last_played': 1542893200}
review: A new telling; somewhere between a Choose-Your-Own-Adventure and a life sim. I've ran through it a few times, and while it gets faster on subsequent playthroughs, I'm still finding new scenes and trying to plot out how to get the endings I'm aiming for. Three have eluded me so far. This is an excellent book, and the choices are even wider than promised - but the fun is in the discovery.

author: {'steamid': '76561198119627681', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 545, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 482, 'last_played': 1482462799}
review:
Choice of Robots goes above and beyond what I expected. 

My initial reaction was weariness, should I spend about $5 on what appeared to be essentially a CYOA book? But, confidence bolstered by previous reviews, and a hunger for story, I decided to purchase this game. 

The story itself is, from the 8 hours and 3 playthroughs I've spent with it, is very good, above your average CYOA. Because of the stats page, and seeing how my stats effected the story, it felt as though my choices where less random, and mattered far more. Though I've played it through 3 times, there feels as though there is still so much more for me to do, and a product that I thought I'd play once or twice has become something I think I'll play many more times.

If you're interested in having even more fun, get a buddy and make every other decision while they make the ones you don't. My younger brother and I had a great experiance doing that.

author: {'steamid': '76561198046049551', 'num_games_owned': 815, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 217, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 217, 'last_played': 1421073664}

author: {'steamid': '76561197984047229', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 458, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 173, 'last_played': 1466325034}
review:
I may have only completed a single story, but it made me cry, and as emotionally retarded as I practically am, that's an accomplishment. I felt this. 

Even as depressing as the journey was that time around, the destination was surprisingly uplifting.

Would definitely recommend to any trans-humans or sympathizers, or anyone else that wishes humanity had sentient company while fearing it would simply kill or enslave it.

Definitely worth the five bucks just for the intense emotional effect.

author: {'steamid': '76561197967590689', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 949, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 944, 'last_played': 1466270923}
review: If you like to make impactful choices in games, if you jump up in excitement at the thought of reading a well thought out and well written narrative that encompasses your entire life as an inventor of robots, well here's the game for you! I've played a lot of the games published by Choice of Games and it's label for less experienced writers, Hosted Games (what they lack in experience, they often make up for by being more open to feedback and criticism and thoroughly beta testing the games before release, but I digress). This is definitely the best one I've played and the sole reason I got into these games in the first place. If you like this I also highly recommend Tin Star, Zombie Exodus, Slammed! and Sabres of Infinity.

author: {'steamid': '76561198136739534', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 617, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 503, 'last_played': 1483568681}
review:
With a very non-linear storyline that can change drastically depending on what "trait" you design your robot around, as well as superb writing that does a good job of inspiring emotion, Choice of Robots is by far my favorite Choice of Games title and one of my all-time favorite games. While one's first playthrough will typically only last a couple of hours, the game is meant to be replayed, and you can easily get at least a dozen hours by making different decisions and going trophy-hunting. Additonally, while Choice of Robots doesn't neccesarily explore any "new" concepts about A.I. and such, the storyline is quite thought-provoking and, at times, a bit sad. And, yes, your choices [i]do[/i] matter, so those of you out there concerned that this is going to be like most modern "RPGs" and have a linear plot with the illusion of choice *brief cough* [i]Fallout 4[/i] *end cough*, don't be. Don't come into this expecting "gameplay" and such, though. It's an interactive, choose-your-own-adventure type title. A text-based RPG, essentially, but not in the same sense as, say, Zork, as in games like Zork, you have to type in your own commands and choices. In this, you have a variety of pre-determined decisions to choose from.

Even if you are not a fan of science fiction, such as myself, you will likely end up enjoying this excellent, thought-provoking text-based RPG. Overall, 9/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198052468901', 'num_games_owned': 2336, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 239, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 228, 'last_played': 1671653285}
review:
At the time of writing this, I've just finished a one time play through.
And I came into this with no real idea what to expect...


I don't really like reading books but this felt like a book to me.
In a nice way because making choices and shaping the story to your wished makes for a truly engaging experience.
The story is so deep, like, really really deep. 
You care for the characters, and from my experience, the characters change based on your choices. My best friend turned out to be a manga artist while my friend who also played the game didn't even have said person in her story at all. 

I do feel like the story is too short, mainly because I was so invested that I felt empty and sad when it ended. 
However, that does not mean it's bad. It's the opposite honestly, it made me, a person that does not really read, wanting more and more until the end. 
And seeing as every choice seems to affect the story, it warrants many playthroughs. And replayability only means a good thing. Certainly when you're looking at +-3 hour long interactive story for only 5 euros.

>>>> Please do play this, for your own sake, you're missing out otherwise <<<<

author: {'steamid': '76561198159581665', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 790, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 693, 'last_played': 1599610564}

 Makes things more interesting.

author: {'steamid': '76561198195628610', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1406, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 876, 'last_played': 1655091493}
review: I've played this many, many times. Great writing, choices actually matter and lead you to many weird (but awesome) places, huge variety of endings. Made me laugh, made me wonder, made my eyes a little misty :,)

author: {'steamid': '76561198032229202', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 6417, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2971, 'last_played': 1610435306}
review: This is a really great old school text based interactive story. You should buy this for the pitance they are asking as it is very entertaining. It take 2-2.5 hours to complete the story. I've played through 15-20 times. In my playthroughs I've become a zillionair, gone broke, created a robot god that controls the world and eliminated war, started my own robot controled country, been murdered by my robot, been murdered by someone who didn't like my technology, ordered my robots to murder my enemies, started a cult that worshipped me and my robot, married a companion bot, become an immortal robot, destroyed all robots to save humanity, made robots that were military, medical, companion, workers, inteligent missles, mechs, drones, etc. I cant stop playing this game because the story is different every time I restart it. I build my own high end gaming rigs and I'm usually interested in pushing maximum graphics at the highest framerate, but the story in this simple text based game just grabs me. I have noting negitive to say about it, the writer is tech savy and brilliant, if I was forced to nit pick and name a flaw I wish the story was longer, it ends too soon. I hope the author writes a longer sequel.

author: {'steamid': '76561198032648533', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 480, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 480, 'last_played': 1440136981}
review: I've played through this a lot, and I really enjoyed the wide amount of variations.  Would greatly recommend if you like adventure games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198098240401', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 52, 'playtime_forever': 477, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 268, 'last_played': 1485104086}
review: I have never ever cried watching fictional movies, TV shows, games... This game however just spartan kicked my feelings out the window

author: {'steamid': '76561198086224610', 'num_games_owned': 769, 'num_reviews': 156, 'playtime_forever': 283, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 283, 'last_played': 1463852915}
review:
Это, наверное, самое лучшее, во что я играл (или читал) за всю жизнь.
Действительно настоящий интерактивный и эпический роман, не хватает только экранизации.
....Так как я пишу это сразу после игры, то немного забываю слова и не знаю, что сказать.... 
В общем, это очень интересное произведение, которое имеет разные истории разного жанра - всё зависит от игрока.

Советую эту игру, но необходимо знать английский язык свободно, иначе, я не знаю, как можно будет разобраться в этой истории и понимать её полноценно.
***
До слёз, до слёз....

author: {'steamid': '76561198031936730', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 908, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 125, 'last_played': 1537052453}
review: This game allows you to create a narrative: beautiful, horrific, poignant or comical, you choose. If you often find yourself imagining what the future may hold then this game is a brilliant way to do it. It's also relevant; many of the choices made in this game will have to be made at some point in the near future.

author: {'steamid': '76561198130434045', 'num_games_owned': 82, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 1041, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 433, 'last_played': 1526875146}
review: This is a very excellently written game and I loved every page of it! It follows your general create your own adventure frame and your ending will vary depending on your actions taken throughout the course of the game. The love playtime is due to the fact that I own the game on my phone and just bought it for PC for easy reading. The only quip I have is that there is no back or undo button. Although it might make the game "too easy," it would make exploring other paths in the game a lot easier and less repetitive. An exceeding great game otherwise!

author: {'steamid': '76561198055094418', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 280, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 277, 'last_played': 1604235820}
review: Choice of Robots is an beautifully crafted interactive novel with more replayability than any other game I've played. I absolutely recommend this game to anyone who's looking for a fascinating story with interesting characters and events. I personally found myself getting quite invested in the story, an experience I hope others too can have (at the very least, try the demo; your save will carry over if you choose to buy).

author: {'steamid': '76561197972029352', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 459, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 459, 'last_played': 1463265350}
review: This is really, really good. Lots of attention to detail.

author: {'steamid': '76561198072444486', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 625, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 425, 'last_played': 1562438615}
review:
Zastanawiałem się dość długo, czy jest to gra, w którą warto inwestować. Brak oprawy graficznej czy muzyki, a także języka polskiego (niestety mój angielski pozostawia wiele do życzenia) nie nastrajał zbyt pozytywnie. 

Zaryzykowałem jednak... i nie żałuję.
Przy pierwszym podejściu zarwałem całą noc, przechodząc wszystkie chaptery na "raz". Jest to gra, w której naprawdę czuje się wagę każdego swojego wyboru. Jak już się czegoś podejmiesz - nie ma odwrotu. Jeśli myślisz, że podejmujesz dobrą decyzję - to prawdopodobnie się mylisz. Czasami te z pozoru gorsze okazują się czynić mniej chaosu.
Gra się naprawdę przyjemnie - ale trzeba mieć wyobraźnię. Ktoś, kto woli oglądać filmy zamiast czytać książki - prawdopodobnie się zanudzi na śmierć. Ale nawet słaba znajomość angielskiego nie przeszkadza (od czego jest dobry wujek słownik. Dla bardziej leniwych - translate.google...)

Polecam zdecydowanie.

author: {'steamid': '76561198067321332', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 15350, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6364, 'last_played': 1501114993}

author: {'steamid': '76561198040890825', 'num_games_owned': 545, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 6170, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5061, 'last_played': 1594709429}
review:

author: {'steamid': '76561198130562680', 'num_games_owned': 239, 'num_reviews': 115, 'playtime_forever': 2387, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2080, 'last_played': 1652566859}
review:
I thought I had already written a review of this game - oh well, it's well worth another one now I've played more of it.

TL;DR > Buy it if you have any interest in what robots might become.

Cons: there's nothing here about how an articulate, general-AI, anthropic or otherwise robot might be made, that's just something you seem to have done in your post-grad studies.
A couple of times there the text doesn't quite keep track of fairly major choices you've made.
Very US-Centric.

Pros:  everything else.
Build killer-bots that take over the world
Build god-bots that take over the world nicely
Build your best friend
Or your 'significant other' that just loves you

Summary for those who did read this far - nicely written, lots of different endings for you, your robots, your friends (if any) and your country (if American).

author: {'steamid': '76561198174389767', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 698, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 13, 'last_played': 1450622840}
review:
I replayed this game so many times. Completely different scenarios and endings each times.

One of the best (if not THE best) text-based choose your own adventure games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198016506227', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 262, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 262, 'last_played': 1441158302}
review:
Really great narrative structure that reveals alot about who you are as a person all along the way.
Worth a couple of bucks the next time you need a quick fix.

author: {'steamid': '76561198038863311', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 360, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 161, 'last_played': 1489991623}
review: NOOOO! How dare you toy with my emotions!

author: {'steamid': '76561198229275376', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 322, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 178, 'last_played': 1461135464}
review: I used to read a lot of choose your own adventure books when I was younger so I am biased towards this genre. Still, let me give an honest opion. I love the fact that there are so many choices and achievements. It's extremely well-written as well with a solid plot and no spelling or grammatical mistakes. If the characters seem a little 1D that's because most of it revolves around you as the protagonist. The story overall is fairly light hearted but occasionally gets philosophical and deep -- a perfect blend.

author: {'steamid': '76561198076696430', 'num_games_owned': 355, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 146, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 146, 'last_played': 1460952549}
review: Just finished my first playthrough -- mistakes were made, hearts were broken, and a life was lived. Fully recommend this to anyone that wants to live a story centered around robotic creation. It is a welcome mental break from real life with a definite feel of living another life. From beginning to end this was a captivating read, and (albeit containing some minor typos) was absolutely enjoyable, frustrating, sad, and wonderfully written.

author: {'steamid': '76561198130669271', 'num_games_owned': 290, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 137, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 136, 'last_played': 1558978175}
review:
To już chyba nie jest gra komputerowa - po angielskiemu gamebook, po mojemu wirtualna książka! 

Jeśli ktoś lubi czytać książki i grać w gry komputerowe,  jest fanem gier fabularnych, rpg, wyobraźni itp. albo po prostu znudził się liniowością fabularną zarówno książek jak i gier - Choice of Robots - "gra", w której możesz stać się panem świata, milionerem, mieć gejowski romans, zakochać się w maszynie albo po prostu zginać w wojnie robotów - wszystko zależy od Twoich decyzji! A ich konsekwencję czasami wykręcają Ci bebechy w brzuchu.

author: {'steamid': '76561198112989387', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 98, 'playtime_forever': 365, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 362, 'last_played': 1598533654}

author: {'steamid': '76561198043657567', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 2318, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1376, 'last_played': 1561430030}
review: Choices matter, and I genuinely enjoyed story (or rather, stories!) that I played through.

author: {'steamid': '76561198110626204', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 563, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 379, 'last_played': 1461904634}
review:
I've played through so far only once but I already know that this is a great game with many routes to take. My journey was one through joy, heartbreak and horror at humanity itself and after swearing that I would put human relationships before any robots I accidentally caused the entire world to be run by robots. I refused modern medicine that I had created and chose the path of a slow death with the love of my life and our child, along with my first true creation, Sapling in a forest far from society and the constant reminder of the world that I created and rejected.

My first playthrough took three hours and had me gripped the entire time, not a game to pick up and put down as often as a phone.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007596670', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 257, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 257, 'last_played': 1419387460}

review:
I built WALL-E then designed a legion of battle droids to exterminate the Chinese menace before happily sending my illegal immigrant wife off to an internment camp (BUILD WALL) and then marrying a sexbot. 

Video games are weird.

author: {'steamid': '76561198046678930', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 3057, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 248, 'last_played': 1482281519}
review: I've already played this game 3 or 5 times through the end. It made me question things outside of the virtual realm. It is as much of a game as a journey throught your own conceptions of whats good and whats bad, whats wrong and whats right. I've been involved with the story as much as I've ever been with any game (well, maybe Bastion). I cannot stop playing it over and over again.

author: {'steamid': '76561198197160294', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 198, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 196, 'last_played': 1460432614}
review:
this game is a true work of art and has captivated me beyond all expectations and to all those who have yet to experience this glorious masterpiece i tell you that this game is what you make it and it is you who are in the story. play as if it were you and you will be the character. forget reality and believe in this story. you will cry, you will hurt, you will destroy and, you will find love.

Gameplay 10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198153426430', 'num_games_owned': 154, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 408, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 408, 'last_played': 1459909054}
review:
at first, it thought i might really like this.

but to be honest the writing isn't "great". it's good, and entertaining in most parts.

but then you get in a romance, and they don't even bother to describe the kiss. you just remove one layer of clothes and it skips to the morning basically. doesn't even describe the little that's there

there are other scenes too, lacking in description that you wish there was more of.

basically it's a PG book, and i wanted a book that was actually entertaining where it mattered

still, i do recommend it, i just wish there was a more fleshed out version

essentially when that happened, i saw no reason to do more than one playthrough

author: {'steamid': '76561198153580628', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1994, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 341, 'last_played': 1549846776}
review:
At the Writing of this Review, I have just finished my first playthrough. At first I thought this game would just be a fun choose your own adventure about robots. But this is so so much more. I quickly found myself caring about this little robot child as if He was my own, trying to do the best for him.  You help shape their personality with your actions, and it shows in every interaction you have with them. I then made the companion robot, this is where the game became truly special. Robot for friends always sounded cool but as lovers and companions? It really makes you think that something doesn't need to be in a human body to love, but it is the mind of someone/something that you really love. 

You can make so many differing choices in this game, From World War, to Utopia to simply having someone to love. You can heartless and make a lot of money or barely make it and have these robots truly become people. No games this simple make you think so much or pulls your heartstrings quite this much.

10/10 Only problem is i wish it was longer.

author: {'steamid': '76561198132250704', 'num_games_owned': 75, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 184, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 184, 'last_played': 1444471308}
review: To be honest not a very good game. Everything is rushed and I didn't particually feel in control of anything. Characters are boring and I didn't feel as though I wanted to "romance" any of them. Unfortunately this game has ruined all these sorts of games for me as it was the first and I doubt I want to waste my time with another.

author: {'steamid': '76561198029178913', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 230, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 230, 'last_played': 1459018889}
review: I've read books! Real books. Many of them of the same genre as this thing. And I find this lacking both as a piece of literature and as a game. And you cannot even change the font size or invert the colors. It is very annoying to have to read the small black letters on the shiny white background. It hurts your eyes. For 5 euros you can get a good ebook instead of a bad game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198032653096', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 9838, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3787, 'last_played': 1676387608}
review:
Honestly probably the best "Choose your own adventure" type story I've played on a computer (old guy that I am I've read quite a few books of that type), and I've played some good ones.
If you're a fan of this kind of thing, of text only adventures, I can't recommend this particular game enough, if you haven't really tried something like this before but you're intrigued to try it out, I can't think of a better first purchase within the genre, and even if you're just passively, moderately interested in this, I recommend at least trying the first 3 chapters for free on choiceofgames.com, to see if you'll like it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198008743668', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 751, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 751, 'last_played': 1495051317}
review: First text based RPG I've played and I loved it!

author: {'steamid': '76561198058037963', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 1170, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 926, 'last_played': 1469874292}
review: This game will make  you feel and make you rage against the man. So many possible outcomes that your head will launch from your neck and create a vortex sucking in all around you.

author: {'steamid': '76561197997789366', 'num_games_owned': 1405, 'num_reviews': 325, 'playtime_forever': 573, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 559, 'last_played': 1621011699}
review:
Great interactive sci-fi novel full of many branching paths and conclusions. The first time I played through this game I put some epic music on in the background and just drifted through it using the music to fuel my imagination as the story unfolded.

It was excellent. The story tuly felt as it were uniquely my own.

I've since played through the game a few more times to see how things could turn out if I made different choices. Will definitely be revisiting this in the future with a fresh mind. I have plenty of unlocked achievements so I know I've not encountered many possibilities!

Definitely worth it for the asking price. If you think you have a good imagination and like sci-fi, you'll love this little gem of a game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198213633803', 'num_games_owned': 326, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 126, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 126, 'last_played': 1456814051}
review: this game is more linear than a telltale game

author: {'steamid': '76561198029677022', 'num_games_owned': 765, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 1594, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 132, 'last_played': 1588122427}
review:
With each playthrough, you've got a 50/50 chance to have either a beautiful, coherent story, or a hilariously nonsensical one. Luckily you can play through as many times as you need until you reach whichever type you're looking for.

Also, achievements.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044505062', 'num_games_owned': 429, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1085, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 767, 'last_played': 1556153715}
review: I killed Tammy and my relationship with her is still at 35%

author: {'steamid': '76561198078748024', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 2963, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 512, 'last_played': 1458115143}
review:
I bought this game on sale with the mindset that I have with most games I buy: "I might play this one day, but I probably won't get around to it". Today, while I was waiting for something to download, I decided to try this game out -- a few hours later, and I completed my first playthrough.

The writing and character customization is wonderful -- I felt totally immersed from the start. The story is exciting and twists in many unexpected ways. Basically, it was one hell of a ride, and I felt like the choices I made really impacted the story, which is something which some choose-you-own-adventure style games lack.

10 / 10 -- didn't know I could be so touched by a story about robots. Seriously...buy this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198050156715', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 784, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 27, 'last_played': 1577184644}
review:
Don't get fooled by the play time not by the simplicity of the game, I've played this game over and over. And I am awestruck...

I sort of ceased being entertained by games, I found them often to be too simple, too basic, but Choice of Robots did something I have not been prepared for. When I launched the game I was expecting a whimsical futuristic tale, instead I was tossed into an emotional shredding machine, by the time I was done with the game I... cannot explain this. For the first time in my life I understood what it means to love you child, and by god did I love mine. It combines the power of the book with the interactivity of a game to absorb you into the story, you will find yourself pensive about the deeper intricities of the game, I sure as hell am not the same person I was before. 

It won't sate everybody however, unfortunately, but those who can appreciate books and futuristic tales will find riveting. Now I need to excuse myself while I cry myself to sleep.

author: {'steamid': '76561198038756361', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 512, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 392, 'last_played': 1653283174}
review: Do you like books?  How about books with words?  Lots of words? And no pictures?  If you've read this so far and you are intrigued... then this is the purchase for you!  As the name implies you get to make choices and these choices affect the story.  Will you find robotic love? Will you defend the USA from an invasion of Chinese Robots? or will you unleash a robotic sentience that enslaves all humanity?  The CHOICE is yours.....

author: {'steamid': '76561198118592661', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 931, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 806, 'last_played': 1520925087}
review: I bought this game twice so I could play It on my phone. I couldnt stand to be away from my graceful, empathetic robot Ulysses, the interesting characters, the phenominal adaptive storyline and plethora of top quality choices to experiment with. If you've never played one then this is a perfect way to start.

author: {'steamid': '76561198036232987', 'num_games_owned': 536, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 2772, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2643, 'last_played': 1680713171}

author: {'steamid': '76561197993254359', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 200, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 160, 'last_played': 1627741553}
review:
At first I remained sceptical to the idea of an interactive novel such as Choice of Robots being entertaining. After reading, or "playing", Choice of Robots for a couple of minutes I was absolutely stunned. The story drags you in as it builds up momentum the more you read, and you end up pressing the 'next' button repeatedly to learn what happens after. It is a great novel, not a long one, but a good one. It is easy to read, and you often find yourself emotionally attached to the different characters that you encounter throughout the story, making sometimes tough decisions which ultimately changes the outcome of the entire adventure.

Choice of Robots is definitely something I will recommend to people. The fact that it is interactive allows the reader to take a greater part in the story and feel that their own presence is present in the story; you are there, you are the protagonist. The choices you make create the story. 

For the low price it is listed here on Steam, Choice of Robots is worth getting. My only suggestion for improvement would be to allow greater interactions with some of the characters, but other than that, Choice of Robots is a solid piece of entertainment. 9/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198072815647', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 70, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 70, 'last_played': 1457772889}
review:
So i dont usually do this. This is in fact one of the few reviews i have ever done but it has been some time since ive been truly blown out of the water by a game. 

I had a great many laughs while playing this game and found that a game i only meant to play for a few hours turned into an entire nights worth of entertainment. True it doesnt have any music and the reading can become tiresome but alltogether an indescribably phenomenal game. 

I truly suggest you spend the money for this wonderful game, get a drink and a snack, turn on a bit of easy to listen to music, and enjoy.

author: {'steamid': '76561198279021205', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 211, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 211, 'last_played': 1457165222}
review:
I have nothing to say that the other reviews haven't, except for one major, game breaking problem.



PLEASE, FEEL FREE TO CORRECT ME IF I'M MISSING SOMETHING, but...


You can't go back to a previous page. You misclick once. And I mean ONCE.... you have to start the game all over again. Especially if it's a major decision. Which doesn't matter, because ALL of your choices matter in this beautiful game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198052716543', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 209, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 176, 'last_played': 1486272776}
review: Surprisingly well-written and engaging. There are constant choices to be made and all of them seemed to matter. I usually find that prospect kind of nerve-wracking, but it was to such an extereme that I just had to go with the flow. I made all the choices that seemed right to me at the time and ended up with a story that meandered to the most unexpected places. Highly recommended for fans of text based adventures, visual novels, and good stories.

author: {'steamid': '76561198139247084', 'num_games_owned': 284, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 1739, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 160, 'last_played': 1656614568}
review:
It's a bit short, since I finished it in about 3 hours, but it is well worth the price. The story begins with you as a college student making a robot. The rest is up to you, as you can make your own decisions. The writing is engaging, simple, and doesn't feel like it bogs down the pacing and momentum of the story when it's describing more technical exposition concerning machinery, so the replayability factor is high. I recommend this to many, but specifically those that enjoy a story that can touch them.


*Update*
The questions of morality and philosophy of science remains provocative, lofty and challenging. Since I bought this back in 2016, I've played it over the course of those six years countless times (now 2022), oftentimes optimizing a single run instead of branching out as much as possible. This and scrolling through possible achievements has kept me coming back, as they suggest wildly different story lines. In equal measure, this game encourages you to become attached to characters and yet try new permutations. Fitting, a story written from the heart a programmer (with a PhD!). The runs don't sacrifice length for the many unique variations; the time it takes to beat and the many strands of story lead from a single premise is balanced. I've played many titles from the publisher Choice of Games, since. This remains the most careful product, it's author like a cautious director in control of everything. Few other titles from them go in the rank with this one. It remains the best example of what its game engine, ChoiceScript, has to offer. Perhaps the prose could be more beautiful, and with that the psychology of characters richer, and with that a greater number of branched plots. But this all suggests wanting more of what's already here in good measure. Because of this I can say: nothing major should added or removed. All the pieces are where they should be. Room for improvement exists only for what's already here.

9/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198202226607', 'num_games_owned': 305, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 132, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 132, 'last_played': 1456951974}
review:
I'd give it a good 8/10. The story is long and there are lots of choices that can and will effect everything you do. Unfortunately, I found myself being stopped when making choices that revolved around a more humane choice(keeping human workers instead of replacing with robots, refusing to make emotionless fighters, etc.) which caused my character's company to fail. Which then made me restart the game. But, I apprciated the fact that my choices constantly mattered.
Perhaps it's the fact that I'm not that quite interested in futuristic robots even though I'm a huge sci-fi fan, but I really didn't feel connected to the characters besides the robot that you first create, I did not want to build emotionless weapons for armies, etc.
In fact, a lot of the characters feel one-dimensional. You get a robot companion who, even though you build it so that it should only reciprocate platonic feelings, still falls in love with you, regardless of the fact that your character is married. There are other examples of one-dimensional characters, but that robot stuck out to me the most. 
That being said, if you love the other stories/games from this company, like sci-fi and robots, then you should definitely play it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198010264267', 'num_games_owned': 389, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 918, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 397, 'last_played': 1530856618}

author: {'steamid': '76561198240569960', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 316, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 207, 'last_played': 1513668063}
review:
1St playthrough: Made a robot that could love to end the war, uploaded my mind into a robot body, fairly unfamous, died poor.

2Nd playthrough: went fuck it, made a robot with a gun arm and a ventian mask face, started a revolution in alaska, got shot to death in a final stand, got mentioned briefly in the history textbooks, died averagely wealthy.

3Rd playthrough: made a graceful robot, decided to let that whole war thing sort itself out, founded a cult around my robot, married a crazy guy, got incredibly rich thanks to my cult, got incredibly famous, had a happy ending watching my daughter and robot play together on her birthday. 

10/10 moral of the story is avoid politics and found a cult to be rich and famous.

author: {'steamid': '76561198069440945', 'num_games_owned': 59, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 530, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 198, 'last_played': 1536343242}
review:
The game feels tilted and like it wants to herd you to certian sides, which thus far are imperial or idle to imperial powers.  I have been looking for that middle ground of passive assertive stand-your ground stuff (i know you might be able to do that one algorithum eventually, but too little too late and most of the time you can't).

I would frequently find myself feeling tricked because there would not be enough information provided for me to make a proper decision and the decisions themselves were underdiscribed such that i thought i would be doing something else.  

All in all, this was still a good game and most of the time enjoyable (but stressful and unenjoyable having my decisions contorted by a lack of choices and information) and there were also many times that i thought "wow they have really made a very intricate game".
I just don't think it should be rated "super overwhelmingly positive".

There should be the ability to undo, make saves, etc.  At least after one full play through or so.

author: {'steamid': '76561198154425859', 'num_games_owned': 1242, 'num_reviews': 97, 'playtime_forever': 4362, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4284, 'last_played': 1456020823}
review:
Most fun I've had in a Video Game without graphics:

Choice of Robots is probably the most intriguing narrative experience I've found in choice / graphic novel genre games. Unlike most games, it does everything well. It would be difficult to say what it does best, but the storyline is definitely an incredible selling point. I like to spin out every scenario in a choice game, seeing what different routes exist, and never rush through. But, honestly, after 73 hours in the game I am sure I still haven't seen every possible twist in this script. 

I definitely got my money's worth from time in game and enjoyment with the game. But, more than that... I found myself deeply interested in the subject matter. I've researched robotics some when I was a teacher, got my students involved in designing robots, and of course was really excited to learn about Honda's Asimo back at the turn of the Century. Now, robotics is the frontier of Science. 

This narrative takes every single idea you might have thought about the Science of robotics and weaves it in to the many scenarios. There are defenses of the "value of humanity," robotics, as well as many other social constructs. And, there are many poignant comments on immigration, America's role in the world, and Capitalism. I got the feeling of seeing America through the eyes of an immigrant. 

But, one of the intriguing things about the layout of the storylines is the very first choice. You start with choosing what dream you will be having at the first of the story. The four choices are all incredible perspectives on the topic of robotics. Though each one lends itself to particular endings, most of the achievements can be achieved through either of these starting points. I just finished my last achievement today with the help of an "Achievement Hunting" friend. Thanks Vance!

The game all revolves around the stats you are building with your choices in each of 4 main traits: grace, empathy, military, and autonomy. These take you into the psychology of robotics. Other factors play into your stats screen as well, such as humanity, wealth, fame, and relationships. But, these are just like tools to help you in achieving your goals with either a robot that thinks, loves, is willful, or militarily useful. You don't feel forced towards any value judgement in your choices, unless you are trying for an achievie that requires high humanity in the end. So, you get to really play with the experience of having the robot hunt down your enemies, or become your greatest friend. 

Whatever you choose, it's all there in the game. Btw, I haven't found another choice game I like as much as this one. Tin Star had a passable story, but it had flaws in the achievement setup, for example and lacked replay value. But, I recently got The Daring Mermaid Expedition, and want to start that next. I only hope it provides as much fun as Choice of Robots.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044433501', 'num_games_owned': 1053, 'num_reviews': 63, 'playtime_forever': 422, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 254, 'last_played': 1476543943}
review: Usually I don't play games like this, but i'm very happy I did cause it's simply amazing. The choices you can make, the lifes you can live are always different and very interessting. Will play this one over and over again 9/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198156385662', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 218, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 80, 'last_played': 1477430140}
review:
Wow. This isn't a game in the traditional sense, but my god is it good. You may start out with good intentions. You may start with evil intentions. You may even start with absolutly no clue what will happen, but one thing is set: eventually, no matter what, your plans will all go to shit. I just wanted to make a friend, and started a world war. I then tried to make the coolest robot in existance, but only ended up alienating myself and my creation from the world.

Massive replayability, deep storyline and a genuinly well written script. Wonderful game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198070552131', 'num_games_owned': 305, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 1221, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 799, 'playtime_at_review': 284, 'last_played': 1711846832}
review: This deserves a longer review.  I meant to play Choice of Robots for 20 minutes to see what it was like and played it for nearly 5 hours on my first run through.   I cried so hard and I lived a lifetime of mistakes and joy and so much more.  I never knew that text only games, a genre of games that I thought had died in the 1980's, could come back 30 years after their time to hit me so hard in the gut.   This is like the time I thought pixelated graphics had died in the 1990's and then I played Papers,  Please for less than 90 minutes only to realize that a game with even the simplest graphics could still have the power to stare into your soul and reveal truths about yourself even you didn't want to admit about yourself or never even knew about yourself.  Games like Choice of Robots and Papers, Please are the kinds of games that prove beyond any shred of a doubt that video games can be the highest of high art and can have asgreat or an even greater emotional impact on you than books, music, TV, and movies, and other art.  I will be playing this game for a long time and I will be gifting multiple copies to many friends in the immediate future and for a long time to come.

author: {'steamid': '76561198058881114', 'num_games_owned': 681, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 73, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 73, 'last_played': 1558998624}

author: {'steamid': '76561198267745141', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 301, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 301, 'last_played': 1496398248}
review:
This game is really, really good. I've been recently interested into choise-based games, and I think this game deserves to figure at top of this category.

There's no visuals or even music in this game, but trust me, it doesn't need it. The text alone perfectly manages to create its own universe. Though, it's only in English (it isn't my first langage, so I needed to search for vocabulary at some times) and you'll still need a good level to understand the game.  

Through the whole game you've got plenty of choices, which leads to plenty of various endings. The choices you make really matters and have consequences, sometimes large-scale consequences. Several times I made decisions that I almost immediately regretted, but most of times I ended up with an ok (and even interesting) situation after all.  

A nice thing is the different choices you make for your robot. You can choose how it will look, how it will call you, if you want your robot to be considered as male, female or something else, how you want to educate it ; and your decisions through the game will influence your robot's personality and relationship towards you. You can decide it will be a killing machine that'll obey your orders, or a nice and friendly robot which can even become your husband/wife/soul mate. 
Absolutely amazing.

Anyway, this game is definitely worth a try. 
No, not a try, a whole playthrough.

author: {'steamid': '76561198026733248', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 1150, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 410, 'last_played': 1455613542}
review: Great game, died twice then on my third try almost took over alaska then finally achieved the singularity. I was blown away by the variance of endings, you may think that after a few palythroughs you would recognize all the copy and pasted text and it would get stale, but after several playthoughs it still manages some surprises and even ask some meaningful questions. If you enjoyed "robopocalypse" or "robot uprisings" or really anything by asimov, you'll definitely enjoy this.

author: {'steamid': '76561198031718399', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 272, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 171, 'last_played': 1481758053}
review: Need 20 more games like this pls.

author: {'steamid': '76561198124976286', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 567, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 567, 'last_played': 1455049023}
review:
Before judging about the quality of this game, I have to say that English isn't my first language. In fact, my school time ended more than twenty years ago. Since then, the WWW is the most relevant exercise.

With that in mind, I was more than excited about this game.  Reading was fluent, through playing I had to look up for ca. 15 words or less. It was entertaining, suprising and I thought about game's decisions in off-gaming time. COR was even good for some loud loughings. Right after the first (around 4.5 to 5 hours) playthrough I started a second one. Imho one of the greatest compliments one can make about a game.

COR was my first interactive novel game ... others will follow, but they will have to meet a high standard. Thank you, Kevin Gold.

####

[i]An deutsche Steam-Nutzer, die vor der Entscheidung stehen ... Ihr habt's gelesen - mit alten Schulenglisch (und das war noch nicht mal besonders gut) kommt man hier sehr gut aus. Es ist (wie Vorposter schon sagten) kein Shakespeare, doch m.E. sehr gut geschrieben. Gebrauchsliteratur im besten Sinne. Die Wendungen kamen für mich teilweise unerwartet, die Geschichte eines Lebens als ganzes (von Anfang 20 bis ca. 70) war höchst spannend. Klare Kaufempfehlung.[/i]

####

First edit: Took a second playthrough. Although I have not finished yet, the story is different to 60 percent . Sure... there are main circumstances, which will probably never change, but the way to deal with it offers great freedom

...

Second edit: Beaten the game three times - each time refusing to build military super robots. But the relationship to humans and robots differed significantly. Perhaps I will try some time the "way of the gun" ... I am still excited of the replaybility of this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198008095952', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 526, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 514, 'last_played': 1455048301}
review:
MODERATE spoilers 
So I make a typical robot, you know robot face, metal body, human height ... extra sensitive fingers and an encrypted hardrive (don't look at me like that, its not what it sounds like) ,  runs on bacon grease. I then get "fired" by my teacher or supervisor for not being willing to make my Robot (Crispin)  less "friendly"  so the military can use him to kill more people in third world countries or whatever it is they do. I then spend the next few years basically trying to make a self relient, self learning and empathetic buddy... or maybe kinda of like a son. Even had him learn the equivalent of secondary school education in a few days so not bad.. However shit hits the fan pretty quickly when candidate president totallynotsarahpalin comes to visit my factory in Alaska (should have seen this coming) asking for me to support her in running for president of which I soundly reply "NOOOoooooooo" but not before mentioning that Chinese hackers tried to get into my robots and failed but still managed to steal their design ... This sent off a cascade of events that ultimately leads to China and the USA sending Robot death machines to kill one another. Completely did not mean for this to happen obviously and I try my best to stay out of the war. Or at least intil the professor from the start stole my designs and sold them to the damn USA military. So theres me thinking oh well my robots are built to help and care for people, maybe even love them so they shouldn't be able to cause too much harm right .... right? ..  NOPE - turns out their best traits , i.e empathy and autonomy made them super killing machines with pinpoint accuracy going around wiping out entire cities. I do manage in the end to escape this and retire but not before china takes my factory, all my money and then ends the war with America before I can respond. Did manage to make myself kind of immortal 
10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197973366094', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 287, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 287, 'last_played': 1454618546}
review:
An interesting read with significant decision-making, done in a minimalist style with just text and some buttons. If you want graphics and sound, look elsewhere, but if you have the attention span to read and participate in a story, try this one. The style focuses on scenes and chapters rather than rooms, so expect to read about a series of events and choose one of several scripted actions rather than selecting "go north" or "get flask".

I've now played through this twice and had very different outcomes and scenes along the way. It looks as though your very first choice selects one of four overall plots, but they overlap. Your decisions affect a set of robot stats, your own "humanity", your wealth and fame, several relationships, and a spoilery thing, but there are also specific details that get worked into the text like your robot's exact appearance -- which in turn affect stat growth. I think I stopped a robot uprising at one point because I'd put effort into the Empathy stat for instance. (The text implied I'd barely had enough in that playthrough.) The feedback, eg. "++Military", is helpful for understanding the effects of my actions.

Noticed one apparent bug: I'm pretty sure Silas tried to kill me for unclear reasons, died, then was back and in a good relationship status in the last chapter. I also found it odd that another character got shot but wasn't marked as dead, and saving another, obviously important character had no noticeable effect. Would also have been nice to see the final tally of the wealth and fame stats have some acknowledgment beyond the stats screen. The game has no "Undo" button like some text adventures, and I have mixed feelings about that. It adds weight to your choices but is a little like the "Fallout 4" experience where you select a speech option only to find your character does something you didn't quite intend.

So, I give this one a thumbs-up. I'm curious to see how modern text adventures do on Steam.

author: {'steamid': '76561197965583985', 'num_games_owned': 765, 'num_reviews': 66, 'playtime_forever': 374, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 374, 'last_played': 1454512993}

Playthrough 2: I built robots for war. The military rejected them because I made them too sentient. I led them in a robot uprising and successfully conquered mankind.

This game has .. REAL choices.

author: {'steamid': '76561198083960848', 'num_games_owned': 787, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 36, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 30, 'last_played': 1527192301}
review:
Вы любите выбор в играх? Быть тем, кем хотели бы быть вы, а не сценаристы? Концовки в виде выбора красного или синего вас уже не впечатляют? А может вы ещё и тру-олдфаг и хардкорный нёрд по кибернетике? Так есть у меня для вас.

20 декабря 2014 года в Steam вышла интерактивная книга Choice of Robots. Да, ребят, книга. Где чёрные буквы на белом фоне, много текста, а ещё это всё нужно читать. Книга. И, как можно понять из названия, в ней есть выбор. И роботы. Нам предстоит сделать много выборов и повстречать очень много роботов. Создать первый в истории механизм, способный испытывать эмоции и любить. Уничтожить к чертям Америку при помощи армии безжалостных терминаторов. Или же объединить все организмы в один большой мета-организм (совсем как в одном популярном аниме). А самое главное – просто умопомрачительная графика, арт-дизайн, звук и озвучка персонажей. Настолько крутая, насколько позволит ваше воображение, само собой.

А если всё же отставить в сторону авторские слабые попытки пошутить, то это просто отличная книга, написанная очень простым, но в то же время очень живым и интересным языком. С горой отсылок к гик-культуре (серьёзно, здесь их чуть ли не больше, чем во всяких Regular Show, Gravity Falls и прочих подобных вещах вместе взятых), с вариативностью, которая возможна только в текстовом виде, и драматичными сюжетными поворотами. Здесь можно стать практически кем угодно, хоть вы и все равно останетесь молодым учёным-гиком, который создал робота. И вы сможете делать что угодно, хотя со временем вы найдете все развилки и поймете, какой выбор ведёт к определённой из концовок.

author: {'steamid': '76561198017283299', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 116, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 116, 'last_played': 1454490608}

author: {'steamid': '76561198045193679', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 100, 'playtime_forever': 347, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 347, 'last_played': 1454431406}
review: Я рекомендую эти игры (на данный момент в Стиме их уже очень много) для восполнения недостатка нелинейности в организме, даже если вы сидите на строгой диете, состоящей из TellTale и BioWare. Принимать лучше всего вместе с любимым напитком и вкусняшкой к нему :) Единственное противопоказание - это недостаточное знание английского. Идеально иметь уровень "свободно владею разговорным английским", да и то иногда встречаются книжные, малоупотребляемые в обычной речи, словечки.

author: {'steamid': '76561197973085805', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 5968, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3817, 'last_played': 1641523469}
review: Certainly one of the top three Choice Of games, in my experience - the story is engaging, and the mechanical design underpinning it satisfying.  So many others in this genre bog statistics down with more than can reasonably be checked, or are clumsily written, or turn into endless loops where you have to already be successful in order to succeed.  Robots manages to hit the sweet spot, where your challenges feel mostly reasonable, fair, and rewarding, inside of a lively and occasionally even touching plotline.  The touch of sadness I felt approaching the end of my character's life isn't quite a pleasant emotion, but it is a sign that something was done right.

author: {'steamid': '76561198279480442', 'num_games_owned': 128, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 358, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 130, 'last_played': 1562846193}
review:
Choice of Robots is a text-based game that will take between two and four hours to play through once, depending on how you fast you read. You play as a talented student in college studying robotics. 

The game offers a few good story strands, multiple choices, and so on. It has about two or three opportunities to die (two before the story truly ends), three "proper" endings, good use of text input, and relatively good variety of choices. That being said, as far as I could tell, there are only two real world states, which are basically "good" and "bad" although both were satisfying to me. 
That being said, I played this four times and found enough new content to keep me interested, and there is a large variety of romance options that contain a modest amount of side content.

The opening offers the most basic character customization with you choosing a first and last name, pronouns, and you're off. This isn't bad, it works. Your robot, however, you also build, and you get plenty of freedom with customization. You can choose how many limbs it has, face, voice tune, power source, tool customization (even a rocket hand). Admittedly, a few of these things have very little story impact, but it makes up with you and your robot's attributes.

The game has a rudimentary point system which keeps track of you and your robots stats, empathy, grace, humanity, etc. These are used every so often as a sort of skill-check for specific dialogue options. A similar system in the game, relationship, also shares this sort or skill-check for each character. If you've played Fallout: New Vegas, it's similar to that.

While there are certainly things to be praised about this game, there is a rather large problem. The writing is bland. That is to say it's not awful, it's passable, but don't expect anything like a run of the mill novel. At best it's probably above the average persons writing ability if they had an editor.

Overall, there is quality content here, and the price is well justified in my opinion, especially as it's usually on sale for about $5.00. Oh, and you can electrify a pickle. How romantic...

author: {'steamid': '76561198152110998', 'num_games_owned': 103, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 644, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 150, 'last_played': 1498584787}

author: {'steamid': '76561198141230623', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 681, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 342, 'last_played': 1617420871}
review:
Amazing

      Choice of Robots is a wonderful game with infinite replay value that proposes many questions about the fate of humanity and robotics. At first when I bought this game, i did not really know what I was getting into, but this was definately a good purchase. Unlike other games who say "Every Choice Matters" when really they just give you options that lead to the same ourcome, Choice Of Robots has infinately many outcomes and endings, based on who you hang out with and othe details.
For Instance, In one playthrough, i became a billionare through my work, in another, I became the leader of a cult centerd around robots!

Truly an inspiring game.
Final Verdict
9.5/10
The only thing that could make it better is if it was free.

review:
Great game if you know how to read. It is an adult version of the Choose Your Own Adventure books from the 80's (but longer, deeper, and better).
My first playthough took about 3 hours. Subsequent games go faster as you can skim the text youve seen before, and focus on the new parts and choices.

My only request is to have an option to change the background from bright white.

author: {'steamid': '76561198056622333', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 164, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 64, 'last_played': 1453597598}
review:
This game was the first interactive novel I ever played by [i]Choice of Games[/i] and boy am I hooked now!

A 300,000 word experience into the world of robotics, artifical intelligence, consciousness, and what it means to be human. Focus on how you develop your robot, and what values you think are important -- will you make your robot more empathic, able to understand humans and work with them closely? Or will you focus on strength and military, making your robot more suitable to the army?

Of course, the choices you make for your robot also affect which companies or people are likely to back or fund your project, and it can have influence on your romantic relationships as well... depending on the fact if you're going down the love bot route or not. Work your way through (robot) wars, ruined friendships, deaths, and try to answer the looming question what will happen to artifical intelligence as it transcends a certain level. Does your robot have a soul? Would you love your robot and let your robot love you, if you could? What choices will you make in the face of The Singularity?

[h1][b]The Good[/b][/h1]
+ Plenty of choices that actually affect the people around you and the outcomes of the story
+ Highly customizable robot
+ The philosophy behind the themes of AI, consciousness, life and death
+ A bit of political play on a large, global scope
+ Plenty of friendships/romantic relationships to develop around you

[h1][b]The Bad[/b][/h1]
- No save points
- A bit rushed towards the ending

If you love these kinds of themes and also happen to like visual novels, you're likely to enjoy this game as well.

author: {'steamid': '76561198055551622', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 2022, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 692, 'last_played': 1663541667}
review: Married a girl and then f*cked a robot I created while hiding it from my wife. 10/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198059195894', 'num_games_owned': 1327, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 1935, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1927, 'last_played': 1486403165}
review: I love Choice of Games's games, and this one is my absolute favorite. I've played through it several times, always interested in trying to do something just a little differently. I'm rather interested in AI technology so playing through this game really feels like peeking into my desires and playing a game made just for me, living a life I wish I could.

author: {'steamid': '76561198111775525', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 268, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 40, 'last_played': 1563769394}
review: An hour in and I already felt severe attatchment to my creation and responisbility to my close friends/loved ones. Shit hit the fan real quick right after a promising start. If you are the type of person that plays games for the story, there isn't a question that you should spend a whole five bucks on this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007640297', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 1145, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1124, 'last_played': 1453561783}
review:
This is a fascinating and very well written choose-your-own-adventure book that cleverly takes advantage of not beeing bound to paper. The choices matter, the storylines vary enormously, not only the narration works quite well, but so do the mechanics of the game. I totally liked to start over and chose different paths, and there are still a lot of paths to go.

I can strongly recommend it, not only for the choose-your-own-adventure-nostalgia.

I am no native english speaker, yet I had no problem with the text. If a developer reads this review, I would recommend to change the layout a little, to make the text even more readable on a big screen. It is totally fine, that there are no graphics, I think it even adds to the experience, as you imagine all of the stuff yourself.

author: {'steamid': '76561198016146729', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 56, 'playtime_forever': 670, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 480, 'last_played': 1499552682}
review: This was a great interactive experience which i played several times over, both good and bad, with different options just to see how my character's life could have turned out. It is all well written and i highly recommend it to anyone who likes the Choose Your Own style of games

author: {'steamid': '76561198091280436', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 1509, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 667, 'last_played': 1465499943}
review:
My heart beats for this hidden masterpiece. Doki Doki Kyun Moe Moe Facepalm?!*&$

Oh, my beloved robot Ruuk, who became the Supreme Archon of a new age of robotic revelation, has made me proud. I still fondly remember the days when she was toddling around chasing a little toy. Rule forever!!!

Then there are the other few times where my cute little robot ruthlessly died and I fell into severe depression. Has Robo-God no mercy?

hUhhH *cough* this contricting feeling around my neck and severe pain accompanying it. Meh, probably just being strangled to death.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972217639', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 1318, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 681, 'last_played': 1702797389}

Extremely entertaining!  Vast variety of "lives" for your character (and their robots) to live.  Well-written, compelling, with lots of fitting popular culture references.

9.5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198141396004', 'num_games_owned': 762, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 568, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 553, 'last_played': 1454221109}
review:
>>胡说的话
通关了一周目大概要9个小时，有时间和心情会再刷一次。
我自己就是个做AI这方面的人，玩这个算相当有同感吧。

>>以下评价源自我的一周目游戏体验。
本作是一个围绕AI建国史的科幻故事。
主角没有[strike]开无双大战300机器人[/strike]成为拯救世界的英雄。
虽然是这场潮流的引导者，但在潮流之中他却是无助而孤独的。
[strike]虽然这很可能是因为我拔掉了所有粉红色路线的FLAG，导致主角无人陪伴。[/strike]
[spoiler]什么！最后居然是机器人结局！主角也变半机器人了！还养了个小机器人你在逗我！[/spoiler]
世界在改变，你有时候在风头浪尖，更多时候只能被裹挟着随波逐流。

>>最后
本作中有一些TG黑的内容，请理性对待。
