author: {'steamid': '76561197995088111', 'num_games_owned': 210, 'num_reviews': 157, 'playtime_forever': 454, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 370, 'last_played': 1639775676}
review:
Choice of Robots n'est rien autre qu'une aventure épique, qui requiert toutefois deux avantages: bien comprendre l'anglais, et avoir beaucoup d'imagination, sous-peine de tomber dans l'ennui au bout de 3 ou 4 pages. 
Oui, j'ai dit pages, car plus q'un jeu vidéo, CoR est un roman intéractif à choix multiple , dotés d'une multitudes de scénarios différents, tous aussi bien écrits les un que les autres.
Fonder une famille et devenir  le riche directeur d'une compagnie internationale, devenir  le nouveau tyran de l'Humanité, créer une secte de robots, devenir un robot, aller sur la lune, emêcher la 3ème guerre mondiale...J'ai rarement vu un "jeu" avec autant de liberté, liberté qui finalement n'as pour limite que celle de votre imagination.

author: {'steamid': '76561197991003690', 'num_games_owned': 559, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 1375, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 340, 'last_played': 1689232021}
review:
You are probably thinking "but it's text, ughhh."

It's engrossing anyway.  It may not be the most in depth look at transhumanist ideas ever, but I really, really, really enjoyed it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198113327887', 'num_games_owned': 128, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 1354, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 275, 'last_played': 1613256175}
review:
Desde hace bastante tiempo me han atraído las novelas visuales. Juegos en los que con tan solo algunas imágenes y una buena historia podías pasarlo en grande.
Después de probar el famoso "Zork" no pude evitar sentir una sensación más bien extraña, pues la libertad que esta clase de juego te otorga es sin duda el punto fuerte del género.
Es un videojuego, se quiera decir o no, pero claro está, es difícil que a todos nos guste a día de hoy probarlos.

Si nunca has leído un libro en tu vida, no te recomendaría empezar con "Choice of Robots" en primer lugar porque está en inglés, y segundo, porque requiere de un largo tiempo de lectura.
Como bien dice el trailer, todo se deja a tu imaginación. Si bien se describen las acciones de forma correcta, tú eres el que va poco a poco armando todo en tu cabeza, y al final, si aprecias leer tanto como yo, lo acabas agradeciendo.

Vuelvo a mencionar el hecho de que está en inglés, pues se requiere un nivel medio para poder comprender la historia en sí, pero siendo sincero, tampoco es para tanto.

Crea tu propio robot, escoge tu propia historia y elige sabiamente las decisiones que tu personaje llevará a cabo, porque acarrearán sus respectivas consecuencias.

Lo recomiendo, me encantan los "Choose your own adventure" y las posibilidades que los mismos dan.

author: {'steamid': '76561198013229293', 'num_games_owned': 208, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 1165, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 544, 'last_played': 1429166492}
review:
Written after my fifth playthrough.

In interactive novels the writing is (literally) everything. And on that merit alone this one succeeds with flying colours. It's just so well written, I really can't praise author Kevin Gold enough. His real-world technical understanding of the concepts involved make Choice of Robots emminently immersive and believable without going (too far) over your head. And beyond the technical details, this is just good old fashioned great storytelling. Whether you choose to roleplay the asocial genius with only robots for friends, a cuthroat captain of industry, a devoted lover, an artist, a power hungry tyrant, or any other of the myriad life paths Choice of Robots presents, this game will tell you a story that is fundamentally about being human. And it's a compelling one at that.

Every time I sit down to play, I'm choosing to reinvest my precious time in a game that I know is going to make me really feel something, and often it's something completely different from the last playthrough. I feel thrilled when a long term goal comes to fruition, and conversely the way things spiral out of control sometimes can be genuinely upsetting. Whether I achieve my starting goals or not, almost every playthrough prompts me to redefine what it means to win. Because five playthroughs in, I'm still finding myself becoming attached to the small cast of characters in new ways. I can't say that about many other games.

Although the replay value of this game is quite high because of all of that, there is one caveat. I'll call it the Taris Effect (KOTOR players will already know what I mean). The story will always start the same way, and there are only a limited number of ways out. The choices in these first big branches can become familiar, and the immediate results start to lose their impact after only a few plays. In Choice of Robots' defense, the number of smaller and more unique branches quickly multiply once you get [strike]off Taris[/strike] out of school. Not really a dealbreaker I'd say.

Overall, if you're looking to try something new or even if you just liked choose your own adventure stories as a kid, then I highly recommend Choice of Robots.

author: {'steamid': '76561198029669648', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 52, 'playtime_forever': 273, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 273, 'last_played': 1431309134}
review:
This game is incredibly charming and well written, especially if you enjoy reading or writing Sci-Fi stories. I just finished Asamov's 'Robot Visions' so this game is right up my alley. Even if you dislike Sci-Fi, the plethora of directions that stories can take based on your decisions adds an entertaining and fresh mechanic with a good amount of replayability. If you've ever had the patience to pick up a book for recreational purposes, you'll be able to appreciate this fantastic interactive experience. 

Get this game! It's well worth the low price.

author: {'steamid': '76561198086872349', 'num_games_owned': 425, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 5183, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 657, 'last_played': 1699560352}
review: This interactive novel is fantastic. It will take you on a journey. It will make you think about the importance and effects of decisions. It will change the way you think about artificial...everything. It is DEFINITELY worth your time and money.

author: {'steamid': '76561198021559677', 'num_games_owned': 421, 'num_reviews': 64, 'playtime_forever': 5523, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3361, 'last_played': 1677080510}
review:
Choice of robots is a very addictive text based game.
Because it offers something i rarely see in video games(even other choice of games)

Choice:
I have play through the story 70 times and every single choice you make change's the story.
I have been a mad scientist, a philantrop, a people person and a loner.
I have build robots for war, for peace, for intercourse, for success and failure.
And not a single time i felt like i was forced to do something.

That is why i love choice of robots.
Where other games stuff must happen for the plot.
In choice of robots the only thing that must happen is that you build a robot.
Everything else change's by every choice you make.

The game is also very believeable.
No techno babble or random unbelieveable hyper tech.
No everything in the game is believeable because it uses stuff most internet user have atleast heard off.

There are so many times when i asked myself:
What did i do wrong.
What choice to i have to change to get a different outcome.
Sometimes it is something as small as being nice or mean to a person you met 3 years ago.

Your robot has four stats.
They effect the outcome of many choices.
The difference between success and failure often relies on your robots have the stats for what you want them to do.

author: {'steamid': '76561198129624903', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 536, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 424, 'last_played': 1544340224}
review: Choice of Robots is a well thought out game. It has many crucial desicions to make, therefore giving it a lot of replay value. There are a lot of possible events to occur in the game. There are many times where you are put into a position where you have to think, and consider the consequences of your desicions. Again, another reason to replay. To choose the path that you didn't before. It is an opportunity to create either peace or war in a fictional world.

author: {'steamid': '76561198079455659', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 64, 'playtime_forever': 311, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 186, 'last_played': 1523772219}
review: The bottom line of this review could boil down to "This game is fun for people who like choices and interactive stories." I had fun playing the game. Other games would claim to present the player with dynamic choices that effect the game world and leave you believing they were meaningful. This is a game that finally does just that. The only thing I didn't enjoy about it is that the UI looks bland. It might seem petty, but even the single person made choose your own adventure images you find on the internet for free have more appealing designs. If your still deciding if you should get it, then just buy it. It's only $5.00 at the time of writing, and if you get at least 2 hours out of it then you got a good deal on a nice book.

author: {'steamid': '76561198072365101', 'num_games_owned': 5420, 'num_reviews': 231, 'playtime_forever': 422, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 149, 'last_played': 1472582440}
review:
Excellent writing and immersive storytelling turnes playing this "interactive fiction lite" in deep experience, Very clever universe with wide variety of different events, choices and their consequences guarantee it´s really a game, not just virtual sci-fi novel. And for more, it´s game with uniquely high replayability, becouse the possibilities of playing are very extensive. Not only cosmetic like in many wannabe "choice matters" games. Exerimenting with your options here can surprise you anytime.

Choice of Robots maintains sharp focus on personal as well as global dimension of story. It gives the game rich and well ballanced combination of emotinal and philosophical qualities. Like in every good sci-fi :-) Well, I even think CoR could easily earn it´s place amongst the classics of genre.

For anyone who likes non-conventional easy to play, but hard to think games, this is an excellent choice.

author: {'steamid': '76561198063816491', 'num_games_owned': 334, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 4598, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1426103475}
review: really cool old scool game great story

author: {'steamid': '76561198185150007', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 361, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 361, 'last_played': 1427728070}
review:
This is my first review on Steam, and I must say that I'm extremely impressed by this game. The level of details and sophistication is over the top. The consequences of your choices are never dull and always exciting and full of emotions. I just love this game and the maker for this experience. 

Pros:
+ The story itself is not linear but very open to your choices so that you can have freedom to decide your own fate in this game.
+ The maker knows what he's talking about about various topics including robotics, artificial intelligence, computer science, and even legal aspects of human rights.
+ The characters are very unique and personal. They are never the same people but are unique in their views and beliefs.
+ The robots you create respond to you according to your decisions.
+ The political aspect of war and moral dilemma was superbly done. I had to pause the game for a moment to decide which choice would be 'right' for me.
+ As a player, you can be emotionally attached to your robot and it feels as though she(or he) is really alive.
+ I just finished the game but I've only unlocked 14 percent of the achievements. There's definitely replayability for this game.
+ Personally, it is far better than your typically 'wifu' games that have shallow stories and charcters. This game allows you to interact with your robots on deeper level.

Cons:
- I really can't think of any. I hope the game would have been longer, but I'm not really complaining.
- No graphics or sound effects, BUT I actually prefer it that way because it forces you to use your imagination. And come on, this game was made by ONE person if I'm not mistaken. I'm still very impressed by the fact that one person was able to write this lengthy scenario of a game.
- More 'war' scenarios with China or other countries would have been nicer.

Bottom Line:
This is an extraordinary game and the maker of this game is brilliant.
Your robots can be as fun and interesting as you make them to be.
It all depends on your choice.
But you might not like this game if you believe that graphics and action are a must in a game.
Personally, I appreciate deep story and memorable characters (I'm also a fan of FF games).
So you'll like it (or love it like I do) if you are like me.

PS: Oh and I'm also a huge fan of robots and sci-fi movies. So, this game was just a delight for a person like me.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994443500', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 825, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 263, 'last_played': 1678693411}

author: {'steamid': '76561197983324441', 'num_games_owned': 677, 'num_reviews': 96, 'playtime_forever': 361, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 361, 'last_played': 1427420806}

author: {'steamid': '76561198062203789', 'num_games_owned': 246, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 383, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 304, 'last_played': 1683914686}

author: {'steamid': '76561197968226477', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 60, 'playtime_forever': 302, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 302, 'last_played': 1427575352}

author: {'steamid': '76561198021183900', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 301, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 21, 'last_played': 1635489826}
review:
If you want a sci-fi text based adventure game, then Choice of Robots is for you.

Like seriously, this game is amazing. Granted, the writing can be a bit clunky at times, the concept is solid and the branches the stories can break into are very different from each other.

The fact that it was inclusive of different genders and sexualities was also a plus and gave the game more depth than some other adventure games. The stats were a welcome addition as well. 

Formatting is easy to read due to the high contrast between the letters and the background and the font is big enough to read comfortably. 

This title is enjoyable.

author: {'steamid': '76561198129565289', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 846, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 558, 'last_played': 1510690905}
review:
I'll say it straight: this isn't necessarily a game that most people would enjoy; it has no visuals and, while in general is short, is a long read for someone who isn't willing to sit still and stay focused for approximately an hour for one play through.

However, for someone who is looking for a good story, Choice of Robots is worth the money you spend on it and is a wonderful narrative. I blog about stuff like this all the time, and am always looking for a good read. Choice of Robots was far better than I could have imagined and was worth every penny, as well as will be worth all the time it will take in order to get each and every achievement.

The story is interesting on it's own; make a robot, decide who to work for if anyone, go through a war, maybe even find love. The choices you're able to make through the game is really what puts the cherry on top of this game; the game's mechanics follow a normal choice based game, but the choices you choose are relevant throughout the story; depending on what you choose at the beginning alters the ending(which is where some choose your own story games lack, and instead, your choice is more relevant between different sections of the story). It's interesting to choose what you would like to do and see all the concequences this leads to.

I won't spoil any of the actual game because it's so worth it to check out the whole thing, but I highly recommend this game. As I said, it was short; for a fast reader like myself, it took a little over one half hour to go through one ending of the game, but it's very touching and you fall in love with the characters you meet/create.

author: {'steamid': '76561197968565253', 'num_games_owned': 1111, 'num_reviews': 110, 'playtime_forever': 3243, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 323, 'last_played': 1431649942}
review:
Very engaging thus far. 

No music, no pictures, just text. A "Choose Your Own Adventure" game apparently. You are a robotic engineer in Sillicon Valley building a robotic companion and shaping the world along the way over the course of your life. Each section of text comes with you making a decision potentially altering your path - what you are doing with your life, how the people around you will react and what will happen with the world as a whole (or not, as being passive is usually an option too). 

There are several values regarding your life and the character of your robotic companion that you'll influence with your choices through the entire game and which will affect the choices you can make later on decisively. For example you can build a humanoid-looking robot and teach him (or her, or it, or whatever - you are given freedom in naming and adressing things) to get along with people increasing his "Empathy" and "Grace" values or, on the contrary, shape him to clearly stand apart from humans and handle guns and stuff increasing "Military" and "Autonomy". This value-play can sometimes feel a bit like a guessing game, and how it will affect your later course is hardly predictable, which can be seen as a good or bad thing I guess, but then I suppose that's just how life works too.

Perhaps at times the game feels a little bit too much like a dating simulator or relationship juggling. Maybe this comes natural with such games and with them trying to resemble life and how choices affect it. I can't say I remember having played anything like this before ("Cinders" maybe), so I don't know. Still: There is a "Romance: ..." placeholder at all times and the game doesn't hesitate to question your inner self quickly whether you have romantic feelings towards a just recently introduced character of either gender, or make them burst out with acts or words of affection towards you right away, which felt a bit unrealistic and forced or at the very least awkward to me at times. 

Sometimes events are pressed on too quickly for my taste. There are some happenings and characters I would love to see elaborated more, but the game can be unforgiving there, making you lose track of them rather quickly pressing onward towards new things and situations. Even some greater time leaps of multiple years it doesn't hesitate to do where a little more patience might have served better. I haven't finished the game yet though so I don't want to fully judge that yet. I don't claim to know better in terms of writing. Perhaps I'm wrong and it's just right, elaborating more could end up losing track of things and aims and such and bloat things up artificially. I just sometimes felt sad and unhappy about the turn of events and how I lost touch to some characters or screwed up in geopolitical questions with no chances of undoing my mistakes. But I guess I can try better in additional playthroughs, as there seems replay value aplenty for all the choices you can make.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998352233', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 1195, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 947, 'last_played': 1685558932}
review:
"And now, Pinky, we will strive to conquer the World" (c) Brain

If you're into the Interactive Novel stuff in the first place, then the game is definitely worth trying out.

Pros:
+ Being a pure text-based, it doesn't bore you to death with pseudo-animated scenes: you progress as fast as you can read, with no need to abuse the mouse and / or resorting to the 'skip it' button;
+ Meaningful choices at the end of each (well, almost each) text block. Each of your actions reflects on your robot which in turn reflects on the next set of actions available;
+ You can actually kill off pretty much everyone mentioned as notable characters in the end ^_^
+ No "sweet-soap" type of happy ending... at least, it is not enforced upon you =)

Cons:
- Not all options are explored to the end. To avoid spoilering too much, let's just say it would have been nice to be allowed to actually join the Dragon or choose a summer house location somewhere other than Alaska

author: {'steamid': '76561197992033387', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 8595, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8307, 'last_played': 1545806726}

author: {'steamid': '76561198178192529', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 466, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 260, 'last_played': 1641575056}
review:
Choice of Robots; a short story in which you can decide the protagonist's (and thus the surrounding setting's) actions to some extent. The story can be anything, depending on your choices, from inspiring to frantic and to emotional, just to give a few examples. The characters have more depth in them than the player would first think; you just need to get to know the characters to reveal other aspects of personality in them. Oh, and the bots, they're the best.

Personally I like this game very much. I would recommend it to anyone who likes reading (sci-fi - or fantasy, too).

author: {'steamid': '76561198094435824', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 142, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 142, 'last_played': 1425709392}
review: I've played a few visual novels before, but never something as engaging and thrilling as this.  The story had me glued to the screen, and I sincerly fell in love with the characters and character development.  The choices were wonderful, and things you thought didn't matter came back to take its toll on you later in the story.  It's a game that you can enjoy multiple times- and get vastly different outcomes.  Great work, and I'll keep an eye out for any future products from this company.

author: {'steamid': '76561198104363648', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 3429, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 309, 'last_played': 1604876031}
review:
My arm was blown off by a bomb and replaced with a gun arm, both of my crushes dumped me HARD, I practically turned into a supervillian, and my robot attacked a government agent. After that, I got sent to federal prison and tried to start a robot uprising in Alaska only to be assassinated by a Ben Folds fan. 10/10.

Seriously though, as a newcomer to interactive novels, I had some serious fun with this game (and completed a much less disastrous playthrough after that first one. Just expect being a warmonger to have some serious consequences.) Try out the demo and you'll figure out pretty quickly whether it's for you. It's like a choose-your-own-adventure book, but ten times better!

author: {'steamid': '76561198055251752', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 190, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 190, 'last_played': 1425056528}

author: {'steamid': '76561198062349464', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 153, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 66, 'last_played': 1436457745}
review:
I feel slightly bad giving this game a "no" for recommendation. This isn't unplayable garbage, nor is it mindless. However, its attempts at intelligence only set it to a higher standard, which it fails to live up to.

First, a story is a lot shorter than I thought it would be-both of the two endings I reached took less than half an hour to get to. This means it's not nearly as deep as the promised "300,000 word epic"-oh, even if it has that many in its files, you'll see just a tiny portion of it. So that's one problem. The second is that while my first playthrough was genuinely "in-character" and ended up with me getting a "bad" (though not unexpected) ending, my second had me actively trying to munchkin my way to a good one (and being at least partially successful).

That I resorted to this was not a good sign. The game is too complex and has too many outcomes for one to just follow a strict "Do X to see Outcome Y", like in some similar "choose your own adventure"-style games. But the differences in outcomes themselves aren't great enough for the complexity to be worth it. Nor is the story great or intellectually stimulating enough-though it tries- to be worth repeating many times.

Ending up as neither robo-fish nor robo-fowl, Choice of Robots disappointed me.

author: {'steamid': '76561198015265080', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 1523, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 645, 'last_played': 1529327025}
review:
Не знаю что именно мне так понравилось: грамотное написание и связка эпизодов или вообще фабула всй игры, но эффект сравним с очень хорошей книгой или фильмом. Грамотно и полностью раскрытая история, где есть причины улыбаться, есть поводы грустить. Choice of Robots стоит своих денег и времени. Отличная интерактивная книга, где можно прожить маленькую жизнь своего персонажа.
Я пока прошёл игру один раз, но обилие ачивок говорит о невероятном многообразии концовок и количество часов в игре общеает быть немалым.
В общем отличная игра. 10 из 10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198053602323', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 66, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 66, 'last_played': 1424749489}
review:
--A MUST BUY--

I purchaced this title because I've always been a huge fan of text based games. Let me warn you about this novel, IF YOU BUY THIS THEN EVERY OTHER TEXT BASED GAME WILL BE RUINED FOR YOU. Kevin Gold did a fantastic job at really telling a meaningful story. All your choices shape the entire story. I was so impressed in fact that I also purchased this game for my iPhone just so I could continue playing on the go. I've completed the game eight times on my iPhone copy and still there's more I could do. Here's a few of the pros and cons:

PROS:
-Long gripping story that will keep you entertained for hours.
-Choices that actually shape the story around you.
-Many different endings that can change with the smallest choice.
-When you think you have a part of the story figured out and you believe you have the perfect stategy for making the most money the game laughs in your face be changing the outcome of that situation on your next playthrough..

CONS:
-Will make you realize that no other text based game can compare.
-Could use a few more main characters in the story. 
 
All in all, I'd give this game a 9/10, worth every single penny.

author: {'steamid': '76561198023080840', 'num_games_owned': 178, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 1095, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 634, 'last_played': 1467288176}
review: Probably Choice of games best game to date. The branching paths are all so different and unique that in one of them I fled to Canada and lived in a penthouse the rest of my days designing sex robots while in the other I chopped off my arm and attached a gun to it then killed the president of the United States with an army of killer robots named after a Japanese Anime pop star. I'd recommend it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007322197', 'num_games_owned': 657, 'num_reviews': 49, 'playtime_forever': 198, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 198, 'last_played': 1424562141}
review:
Robots... written story and no pictures... Someone audacious enough to put this on steam must have somethign very well made or tries to get my money for something bad. 
After reading an hour  and making decisions for my robot (i called him Asimov ;-) ) i must say that the story really gets interesting. Getting moraly questioned and such is ... fun. It's well written i think, and the questions are not "difficult" but still very hard to answer. 
If you want to slow down... and relax with a good book... consider this game as a good replacement of a book. 
I am happy i jumped in and love it. Do i recommend it? yes. (but i can understand why it's not for everybody. It's a good read and maybe ZORK has influenced my wish to read and decide to play this game. 
Even now i am curious to more of these kind of games. 
I would say... give it a try and let me know how your robot turns out. I really would love to know. 
So my robot is very new, autonomous and intelligent. he is well mannered and likes other individuals.

author: {'steamid': '76561198155431289', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 56, 'playtime_forever': 577, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 339, 'last_played': 1552748649}

author: {'steamid': '76561197967063236', 'num_games_owned': 930, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 994, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 688, 'last_played': 1425549251}
review: If you enjoyed choose your own adventure styled books you'll really enjoy a lot of the Choice of Games products. Sometimes it's nice to just read and use your imagination rather than have amazing graphics. Choice of Robots had me on hte edge of my seat, which I completed for the first time the very night I started reading. Characters and story are well written, now I just need to go create a real life robot and I'll be set!

author: {'steamid': '76561198002511762', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 2369, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2077, 'last_played': 1440326821}
review:
I used to love those "Choose your own adventure" books when I was a kid. I'd sit and reread them over and over trying to find all the different ways the story could play out...

This game is like a super version of those books and less than an hour in and I'm already loving it. I highly suggest this game to anyone who doesn't need pretty graphics to enjoy a game.

The further I get into the game the more I recomend it. In the current enviroment of gaming you lose sight of simple mechanics such as choice. This game gives it out in spades. By the time I reached the end of it I had a sense of being in the world created around my choices.

For the price asked I cannot think of any reason you should skip the experience provided by this game.

If you have trouble gettting into something without graphical feedback I can only tell you that for $5 this is one of the best personalized gaming experience you'll find by far. Please give the developer your support so that we might enjoy similar experiences in the future.

author: {'steamid': '76561198081138826', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1246, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 739, 'last_played': 1577394771}

I would recommend it to anyone. I stated off trying to make a robotic child ala AI and ended up killing most of the human population. 10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198007109287', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 4104, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2886, 'last_played': 1670065301}
review:
Spoilers!

Theres no pictures, no audio sound, but this a very moving chose your own adventure story. Using your mind to create the never ending wounder.

My first play though, lead me to create my own company making Medical A.I., got sued, then a nation stole my design, bankrupting me.

Even a close friend had to flee the country, All along the way my A.l. robot, Ally was a fateful companion, and in many ways my child.

If your looking for a good story were you have a real part in how it's shaped you should pick up this game. Skip that 5 dollar Mcdonalds run just this once.

author: {'steamid': '76561198051359331', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 3090, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2836, 'last_played': 1423700905}

Its also very cheap! if you like choose your own adventure games, you will likely enjoy this. I would recomend trying out "choice of the dragon" on the publishers website first, it will help you decide if you really want this or not. Either way, I hope you enjoy the game!

author: {'steamid': '76561198051710824', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 695, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 695, 'last_played': 1419550970}
review:
So, you're an aspiring inventor making your way through college.  Countless hours of work has all lead up to this; you've invented a robot, the first of it's kind. Do you decide to make them out of Wood, full of beauty and grace? Or perhaps strong durable steel, all but impervious to damage!? Maybe, just some plastic polymer, you do have a budget after all. None the less, your creation shall be your own. Weather you decide to nurture them into a companion with a love of learning and humanity; or a soulless killing machine only doing what it is told to do. You shall not be alone in your task, nor shall you be unnoticed. Power struggles, international politics, corporate America; None will let you go so easily. 
Your choice is your own.

[h1] Choice of Robots [/h1] is an incredible choose your own adventure style game. You can play a number of different routs with your own style, I personally like to make [spoiler] some robot overlords, don't worry they're friendly [/spoiler] ! If you like Sci Fi or any of the Philip K. Dick novels, [i] hell even the matrix movies are referenced and add a nice nuance to the game [/i], then you'll dig this game. 

Now quick break down of the game, interface is about as minimal as you can get, your story with text and a choice, 3 options on top;
 [list]
[*] Stats: view you robots stats and your money in pocket.
[*] Restart: there are no save slots, no save scumming out a different ending here buddy.
[*] Achievements: self explanatory.
[/list]
Though I find this helps the game out, it doesn't force you to envision what the devs had in mind but instead allows you to make your own characters and scenery up in your [u] [i] imagination [/i] [/u]. This might be difficult for some if you're just that bland but, come on it's a CYOA game. 

All in all [h1] tl;dr [/h1] 9/10, this game made me cry on more than one occasion and then had me spiral into a ocean of introspection all while lifting me back up and making me smile and feel happier about my decisions. With out the use of graphics or much of an interface Choice of Games has made characters that feel as real as the friends, family, and rivals you have in your own life, all wrapped up in a wonderful world not far off.

author: {'steamid': '76561198104003565', 'num_games_owned': 262, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 894, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 407, 'last_played': 1559504504}
review:
Великолепная интерактивная новелла (требуется неплохое знание английского языка). Одна из немногих игр, в которой ваш выбор действительно имеет большее значение, чем определение цвета большого взрыва в конце. Как насчёт создать армию смертоносных машин, без единого сомнения уничтожающих всех врагов Соединённых Штатов? Или помогать людям всего мира, создать себе робо-компаньона, жениться на нём/ней и жить счастливо до конца жизни? Может желаете независимой Аляски под управлением тирании в вашем лице? Решать вам. Количество предлагаемых выборов и их влияние на события заставляют такие игры, как Mass Effect, The Walking Dead и The Wolf Among Us нервно курить в сторонке.
Если же вы знаете наизусть 3 закона Азимова и читаете последние новости о достижениях робототехники, то чего же вы ждёте? Вперёд и с песней!

author: {'steamid': '76561198060793891', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 76, 'playtime_forever': 580, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 145, 'last_played': 1645836554}

author: {'steamid': '76561198117935424', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 553, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 195, 'last_played': 1447717498}
review:
Wer es mag, seine eigene Geschichte erzählen zu können und zu sehen, wie die eigenen Entscheidungen den gesamten Verlauf der Handlung beeinflussen, der wird Choice of Robots lieben.

Dieser interaktive Roman erlaubt es dem Spieler nicht nur, seinen eigenen Weg durch die Handlung zu gehen, sondern schult darüber hinaus wichtige Fähigkeiten wie aus den eigenen Fehlern zu lernen oder im Voraus zu denken. Die Spielzeit für einen Durchlauf würde ich auf etwa drei Stunden schätzen.

Wem die Tatsache, dass Choice of Robots textbasiert ist und ohne jede Grafik daherkommt, sauer aufstößt, dem sei gesagt, dass es mich delbst positiv überrascht, wie wenig das einen als Spieler stört. Genau diese Lücke ist es, die die Fantasie des Spielers anregt und ihn dazu motiviert, sich die Handlung visuell vorzustellen.

Das Einzige, was ich an diesem Spiel wirklich zu kritisieren habe, ist, dass es ausschließlich auf Englisch erhältlich ist; Wer des Englischen nicht mächtig ist, dem sei nicht unbedingt zum Kauf geraten.

Alles in allem jedoch beweist Choice of Robots sehr eindrucksvoll, dass textbasierte Spiele in der heutigen Zeit immer noch Spaß machen können

author: {'steamid': '76561197960935919', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 412, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 412, 'last_played': 1423134921}

author: {'steamid': '76561197967244540', 'num_games_owned': 562, 'num_reviews': 106, 'playtime_forever': 810, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 810, 'last_played': 1502851335}
review:
Excellent sci-fi choose-your-own-adventure.

If 'I, Robot' is a book (not a movie) to you, if you know what 'Do Androids Dream of Electric Sheep?' is, and so on, you won't find anything surprising here, content wise. It's a bit of a compressed version of things that have already been said--but you get to choose your path through it.

There's some genuinely moving moments and some genuinely depressing/tragic ones, depending on the choices you make.

It's worth playing a second time at least. One pass-through feels like maybe 1/4 of the total content.

Rating: B+

EDIT: I just played through this again, over a year later, after having played many other text-choice-games, and I like it even more. Upping my letter rating to: A-

author: {'steamid': '76561198036901397', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 993, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 346, 'last_played': 1679231327}
review: Choice of Robots may seem like a boring text based game but I can promise you that it is not as simple as that. Many games nowadays, claim that your in-game decisions affect the outcome and thats mostly bullshit. In the case of this game however, it is definately true that your choices affect the outcome. I highly recommend this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198052907588', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 341, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 163, 'last_played': 1549021579}
review:
It's amazing what a game can create in the mind of a player, as very few games, with so little, make make feel a great story.

Choice of Robots is essentially Isaac Asimov books with adding a recent history and characters of the field of robotics and technology.

Full of philosophy and leaving it to the reader/player these issues since the early emergence of artificial intelligence have come by many literary thinkers.

Undoubtedly, it is a great work.

author: {'steamid': '76561198032073091', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1088, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 700, 'last_played': 1431559937}
review: I really enjoy playing this game.  It reminds me of the old "choose your own adventure" novels, except with a more philosophical bent and an rpg element.  The choices you make have an impact on society, as well as your own personal relationships.  You grow to love your robot(s), who learn and grow and change with every decision you make. You agonize over choices that could have far-ranging and profound effect.  I'll definitely play all the "choice of" games that come out.  I give this one five stars.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030736428', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 550, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 222, 'last_played': 1520152498}
review:
of the over 200 games in my library THIS is the best one yet

RIP-Darwin Tesla 1995-2049 (SPOILER ALERT)

starting off at the age of 19 creating the first (aptly named) Drone. this companion would be with him till the day he dies.

yet never learning that he should have just told the media to "fuck off."

Though before I can tell you his story it's best i describe Drone to you: Drone has a panoramic head with multiple cameras for a great enviromental awearness attatched to a relatively small chassis containing a motorcycle battery with a small pair of helicopter like blades for flight as well as insect like wings for stability

Now that thats out of the way:

When he first activated drone he did so looking directly at her (he had decided to refer to Drone as feminine due to the sleak design) so that the first thing she would see is him over night she went through a simulation of kindergarden to highschool and very soon he found himself with drone in everything from the the front page of the new york times to starring on the late show Drone was originally designed with military purpose in mind starting from killing someone who sent him a death threat to assassinating the first person involved with Drone in military purpose (the day after drone was first created) skipping ahead a few years Darwin found himself at the funeral of his father having died from a tumer which would ultimately be the death of Darwin himself.

((i should have known the option to see if it was genetic was going to bite me in the ass))

Drone by this point was the size of a person and Darwin was close to opening his first factory which he had decided would be completely autonomous creating exact replicas of Drone using the identical AI knowing everything Drone had learned up until this point

(a few more years ahead)

china had stolen designs of Drone but they weren't as good though carrying rifles were far more deadly especially when the chinese president himself was on a parade though the streets one of the bystanders had opened fire sparking a skirmish between the people and the chinese droids Drone had tried to protect the president though this was mistaken for an act of hostility in the end causing Drone to be shot in the centre most camera which is why Darwin tried to resue her resulting in him being shot in the crossfire which meant he had to amputate hes arm though being the robotics genius that he was he built himself a new arm (which proved to be useful upon his death) this one with a gun inbuilt so that he would never be defenceless again

And this is where i leave you to make your own story and see how amazing it this game really is.

(SUPER SPOILER ALERT)









The genetic disease Darwin had (as mentioned earlier) both caused his death and let him live because it both made him smarter but over time caused large portions of his brain to shutdown instead of surgery to fix this he decided to build himself a new artificial body entirely which was only finnished in his dying moments as he desperately clinged to life just to flick that one switch which would turn on his mecanical doppleganger which was the last thing Darwin would ever see as it left the room if he didn't create his mechanical arm he would have likely died before being able to complete his new body

As told by: Darwin Tesla's mechanical copy

author: {'steamid': '76561198047276298', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 4913, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 445, 'last_played': 1506382681}
review: I have a lot to talk about this game, but I'll try and make it as short as possible. This game may be one of the most brilliant I have ever played. The storyline is amazingly well-crafted, with so many differant possibilities made after every choice! The main characters you meet all have very wonderful and colorful personalities that you will either enjoy, or clash over in the game. However, as it's obvious from the screenshots and such, this is a text adventure game. So if you want the full enjoyment, yes. You will have to read. A lot. But if that dosen't keep you from hitting that buy, then do it now. For only a 5$ game as of now, it is definitely worth the price if you just don't mind reading it. This game definitely has my stamp of aproval, no matter how little the stamp of aproval is for some random person on the internet. So once more, if you don't mind it's text-heavy gameplay, buy this game immediately. You'll get your money's worth.

author: {'steamid': '76561197977977601', 'num_games_owned': 216, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 1168, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 770, 'last_played': 1527536668}
review:
This game is thoughtful, beautiful and imensely entertaining. It's smart and funny, packed with puns and refferences. 

Every nuance in every choice you make will have wonderfull and terrible consequences, and after you finish the game once with the choices you think seem reasonable yourself, you can play the game at least 10 times more and experience 10 completely different and interesting stories, and it will be worth it (just make choices based on different values, you will be surprized at what is possible in this game). 

This is the best 5 bucks i spent on a video game in a long time. If you ever thought reading was boring, get this game, and think again.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045505823', 'num_games_owned': 514, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 783, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 215, 'last_played': 1464025565}
review:
This game is amazing!!!
My first play was in the demo just to, you know, try it, and I got so immersed in it, I had to get the full game.
When I've finished I was stuned and full of emotions and thoughts, even without graphics or soundtrack It's beautiful, the narrative is great and the characters are charismatic enought to make you like them, I don't even need to say that the robot is the most charismatic, I loved my robot Ariel, I couldn't even try to dislike her.

I really liked this game!!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198011866221', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 78, 'playtime_forever': 2439, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1002, 'last_played': 1508943730}
review:
This game is really deep. I really have to say, this game is true to it's work. Every choice has a reaction. And you'll be surprised at your ability to bounce back from terrible things, or thrive because of them. Or make really good choices that turn out far worse than you thought.

I don't want to spoil anything, but there are so many story branches and ways to develop your main robot [you can make others in groups but only really interact with your main one as an individual.] so many branches that every playthrough I actually have a hard time finding a branch I wanna try again. Absolutely amazing game if you like reading.

author: {'steamid': '76561197967339388', 'num_games_owned': 1473, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 120, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 109, 'last_played': 1558766730}
review:
Caliban más volt, mint a névadója. Teljesen más.
A teste finoman megmunkált fából készült, míg az arca és keze egész emberi volt. Kalibán Nő volt. Okosnak és rendkívül egyedinek számított a társai közt, de ez nem meglepő. Alan Calvin készítette, aki mindenképp hű akart maradni a nevéhez. Bár soha nem találkoztak, és rokoni szálak sem fűzték Susan-hez, mégis úgy érezte, hogy örökölt valamit. Örökölt valamit, amivel jobbá tudja tenni a robotokat, és talán elérni, hogy az emberek jobban elfogadják őket.
Talán most sikerül. Talán Alan meg tudja csinálni.
Talán Alan képes rá, hogy Ő írja a saját történetét.
Nem, ez egészen biztos.
Alan az író és a főszereplő is. Ő, és barátja Caliban.
Vagy a szerelme?
Meglátjuk. Csak rajtunk múlik.

author: {'steamid': '76561198037228955', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 34, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1532248763}
review: The only reason I didn't manage to make my robot the messiah was because I got thrown in prison and roped into building robots for the military. 10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198077867048', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 393, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 393, 'last_played': 1422498938}
review:
Wow. This is everything I ever loved about science fiction, packed into a single experience. It reads like oldschool sci-fi, with clear references to Chapek and Lem, but plays like a permadeath game. where stupid decisions actually hurt. 
Choice of Deathless was aboslutely fucking awesome, but this is another level. In every playthrough it managed to surprise me. Three robots I made actually seemed to have different personalities. Romance was romantic. Megalomania was cool and destructive on grand scale.
Excellent game.

review: Ich kann jedem , der Bücher, Pen n Paper, RPG , Open World etc. mag nur empfehlen dieses Spiel zu kaufen. Man kann es auch allen Leuten empfehlen , die  über das normale Schulenglisch verfügen, da die Sätze einfach formuliert sind (einzelne Vokabeln kann man ja mit Hilfe eines Übsersetzers nachschauen) . Alles in Allem eines der Besten Spiele, die ich die letzten beiden Jahre gespielt habe! Großes Lob !

author: {'steamid': '76561198072244974', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 1494, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 316, 'last_played': 1598535054}
review:
tl;dr
No FOV slide, -5/10

"Full" Review.

Now since this is a Choose Your Own Adventure(let's call it for now CYOA) , it makes little sense to write a traditional review. What I can say about this  game is that it's pretty great if you're interested in AI and Sci-Fi(and CYOA Games, duh), then you will enjoy it, alot. I played through it twice already it I had two completely different stories, dispite some events remaining more or less the same. There are only two negatives to this game that I have found, 
A) Is there a save option? Can I contintue if I close the game? A possibility to close the game normaly to begin with?
B)Also, no FOV slider.
Both of those are however rather irrelevant I found.(B was irrelevant too for some inexplicable reason)
In the end, you will get your money's worth as this game only costs 5 euros (Or your local equivalent).

author: {'steamid': '76561198037386911', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 3466, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1422938169}
review:
Great game
I only wish at some parts there had been an extra option, or another choice after one had been made to give me more control but its still amazing. It would be awesome if it gave you a transcript of the game too

author: {'steamid': '76561198162130792', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 4803, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 873, 'last_played': 1495575520}
review:
Well written and thorughly enjoyable. Even after my fifth playthrough I was finding surprising differences resulting from my choices.

I first reviewed this On Jan 25 2015 almost a year ago. Since then I have had a chance to play a lot of "Choice Of" games and this one still stands out as one of my favorites. The paths branch in totally different and satisfying ways and the wrriting is still solid throught. 

If you are considering getting a "Choice Of" game for the first time or you simply don't have it yet you really need to buy it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030827914', 'num_games_owned': 671, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 351, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 351, 'last_played': 1527364926}
review:
I have played the game through three times now and love it. the game has a great many choices all of which make you feel like they had a significant impact on the story. I genuianly felt for characters on my first play through and impact I had in this world felt significant. after the first play through you start to play the game in a more min-max style, hence making the connection between you and the world worse but the overall game is still enjoyable. The first playthrough is an amazing expirance in its own right making it well worth £4, if you can extra playthroughs out of it it is well worth the money not a question about it. 

A tip, on the first playthrough try to ignore the stats screen for the most part, check out how much wealth you have but no more than that. avoiding this screen can help avoid the potential to try and maximise gains rather than enjoy your story.

review: I would absolutely recommend this game to anyone who's a fan of classic RPG text-based games. Very well done and you can see that a lot of care was put into this game.  Simple, beautiful, and even made me tear up towards the end of some paths.  Definitely worth the $5 -- endless amounts of fun and plenty of different outcomes!

author: {'steamid': '76561198069947508', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 5530, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 680, 'last_played': 1562719290}
review:
Amazeing. i bought this game in the heat of steam winter sale by mistake. i was expecting a more... graphic game. What i got was one of the single best RPG experinces of my life. The writeing is great, the story is wonderful, gameplay mechanics are perfect.

Get over the text adventre thing. You will not regret it.

review:

In another playthrough, I started a robot-based religion.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043162108', 'num_games_owned': 298, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 696, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 695, 'last_played': 1450139875}

And there are a LOT more choices and outcomes I have to explore. It'll be a looong time before I finish this gem.

author: {'steamid': '76561198046002262', 'num_games_owned': 560, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 714, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 436, 'last_played': 1668930334}
review: A choose your own adventure game with an amazing narrative, and brilliantly painful decisions at every corner. This game will take your breath away, make you fall in love, and make you hate yourself at the same time, and I've never loved it more.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044636773', 'num_games_owned': 111, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 624, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 355, 'last_played': 1502335421}
review: This is another amazing game in the growing line of Choice of Games text-based titles. The story, while seeming to be simple, is a complex and multi-layered path to several different endings. You, as the protagonist, give the gift of life to an AI robotic unit. It's up to you to decide if the little (or not so little!) droid will grow on its own in a world of peace-loving automatons or become the instrument of destruction for the US/China in a war that's been brewing for years. Or just use it as your tool for domination of the planet. With many little references and funny jabs at not only themselves but also current pop-culture, Choice of Robots is a great game to show your friends to introduce them to the text-based game genre and hopefully bring you all together to create your very own dream robot.

author: {'steamid': '76561197996438236', 'num_games_owned': 504, 'num_reviews': 63, 'playtime_forever': 318, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 241, 'last_played': 1519026708}
review: This game (I think the ESA's "interactive entertainment" has never been more appropriate) is for you if you're looking for a marriage of a quality sci-fi novel and a video game.  The reading/comprehention level is probably at least high school graduate if not more (at least on the comprehention side).

author: {'steamid': '76561198167920591', 'num_games_owned': 141, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 449, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 185, 'last_played': 1423951359}
review: I love this game. Flat out love it. I enjoy reading to an extent, but this was so much more than that, it wasn't just making blind choices. This game made me think about every choice I made, I would spend a couple of minutes on some of the options, debating the consequences. "How will this affect my relationship with this person, or that person." "Will this be a step in the right direction, or will it just bring me money and make me less of a person." Every choice is thought out and that's what makes this 'game' special. I've played through it once and plan on playing it many more times, seeing how much I can change the outcome of my protaganist, or the whole world.

author: {'steamid': '76561197996967839', 'num_games_owned': 512, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 2455, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1128, 'last_played': 1434702664}
review: Took me back to the days of Infocom. Also, mildly surreal - I am a professional roboticist working in the Bay Area, and I've caught at least one scene that is from my life ;)

author: {'steamid': '76561198019962367', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 708, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 330, 'last_played': 1450648009}
review:
Choice of Robots is a very emotional game, with a lot diversity of content. Now, there are a few paths that basically lead towards the same directions and the same events that happen no matter of your choices in game. In other words it is the same skeleton, but the skin differs based on your choices.

Now I wish I could say more, but experimenting with different paths is too time consuming as there is no save-game feature. I mean the game saves when you exit, but if you make a mistake, it means you must restart the game. So experimenting with different branches after the initial playthrough is discouraged, due to the tediousness of having to go through the same choices everytime to get to a divergent point that you are interested in.

I have few hours on record due to the fact that I completed the game twice in a relax reading session, but again, the lack of a Back option or of a Save feature, discouraged me, as I do not like tedious activities. As such I couldn't experiment more with it.

I would rate it at a pleasant 8/10, good content, diverse storytelling based on your choices, you actually get to care for your actions. If it had a save feature so I can easily play other divergen paths, I would've rated this 10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198013782020', 'num_games_owned': 404, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 276, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 354, 'last_played': 1431651115}
review:
I just finished a Choose Your Own Adventure novel. Go play it.

It's called Choice of Robots.

I finished with my family living in a luxurious mansion in Hope, Canada.

I had a robot BFF named Astrea, a former-co-worker wife named Tammy, and an 8 year old daugter name Yeada.

It was great.


I started the game at the age 24. I finished it when I was above 50. During that time I had run-ins with the FBI and the Air Force, I started a robotics factory in Alaska, that factory burned down, mind you, my father died, a war between China and the U.S.A started, and I made 'anatomically correct' robots that ended up making only about 15% of the U.S.A employed.

That is the life story of Daemon Lunar.

author: {'steamid': '76561198110953466', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 479, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 365, 'last_played': 1463282107}
review: Worth every penny.

author: {'steamid': '76561197977919238', 'num_games_owned': 277, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 636, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 636, 'last_played': 1421654022}
review:
Despite being a text only choose your own adventure, the game manages to be incredibly engaging and immersive. There is a slight RPG element which adds to how connected you feel to the story and gives you a nice summery of the actions you have taken and their consequences. I found myself going through the story over and over to see how different choices played out, which were not always obvious. Even if you have an intended goal, there is not a clear cut path to reach it, adding greatly to the replayability. I have never played anything like this before, but I will definitely be looking into the other titles by Choice of Games.

The only bad thing I can think about this game is a lack of saving or being able to redo a choice. If you accidentally select something you don't want, the only way to correct it is to restart the game. Which is not too bad, if you remember all the choices you made it only takes a minute to quickly do them over.

author: {'steamid': '76561197996336464', 'num_games_owned': 524, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 674, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 674, 'last_played': 1422056751}
review:
This is indeed one peculiar game. It's not something new,this kind of games were used a lot in the 80-90s,however it brings newness in the form of technology and science.The story it's very good and well-told,in the late-game it even acquires the right depth and seriousness without being too much hefty. The game makes you think alot about many different topics,it's contemporary to our time and could "conceal" some possible outcomes...but that'd be just speculation.
It's a game for everyone with high replayability and very few constraints. I'd reccomend it to nearly everyone who like to read books as much as playing videogames.

author: {'steamid': '76561198139329099', 'num_games_owned': 469, 'num_reviews': 78, 'playtime_forever': 120, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 120, 'last_played': 1421589512}
review:
[h1]"Algunas cosas están bajo nuestro control y otras... no 8.7/10"[/h1]

Choice of Robots te pone en el papel de tu "yo mismo" de 24 años, durante un proyecto para tesis bajo el apoyo del doctor Ziegler. Este "proyecto" resulta ser un robot, que tu mismo podrás diseñar de la cabeza a los pies. Elige orientarte hacia los humanos o los robots y cambia el curso de la historia y la vida misma.

Choice of Robots, cuenta con más de 300,000 palabras de historia, lo que asegura que tu partida nunca será la misma dos veces, con tantas variables y finales posibles, CoR, tiene contenido para mantenerte leyendo por días.

¿Como cambiarás el mundo? Apoyarás la creación de robots con fines militares o usarás la inteligencia artificial para conquistar el mundo? Doblegarás el mundo ante tus pies o los robots serán meros asistentes de la humanidad? En CoR tendrás el poder de promover o detener la rebelión de los robots sobre la humanidad.

Después de varias partidas diferentes podrás ir encontrando momentos que no te habían sucedido en la anterior, también podrías resultar muerto por un error que tampoco has cometido, pero ahí se encuentra el encanto de Choice of Robots, nunca sabes que pasará esta vez, por lo que cada partida se vuelve un mundo único y propio, dejando a tu imaginación desenvolver tu historia a través de simple texto.

[h1]Pros:[/h1] [list]
[*]Tus decisiones alteran el flujo de la historia, mismo que añade re-jugabilidad al poder comenzar bastantes partidas diferentes.
[*]El escritor, Kevin Gold, ha sabido mantener el flujo de la historia a pesar de las diferentes decisiones.
[*]Cada partida será única e interesante.
[*]El titulo se encuentra disponible a través del navegador y dispositivos móviles.[/list]

[h1]Cons:[/h1] [list]
[*]Al igual que el resto de juegos de Choice of Games, es solo recomendable para personas con gusto por la lectura.
[*]El juego solo está disponible en inglés. (Esto no es un punto negativo para mi, pero puede presentar un  problema para aquellos que no hablan inglés)[/list]

[h1]Conclusión:[/h1]
Como todo juego del genero es un compra recomendada a personas que gustan de leer, pero si quieres darle una oportunidad a una historia construida por tus decisiones y jugar algo nuevo y diferente debes darle una oportunidad a Choice of Robots, el juego tiene un demo disponible en la pagina web de Choice of Games y a través de Steam.

[url=https://spoileverything.wordpress.com/2015/01/18/review-choice-of-robots-cambia-el-curso-del-mundo/] Análisis completo en Spoil Everything [/url]

Análisis basado en una copia digital del juego para steam, facilitada por el equipo de Choice of Games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198086946088', 'num_games_owned': 602, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 266, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 263, 'last_played': 1558819199}
review:
Действие игры происходит в не очень далеком будущем - оно начинается в 2019 году. Главный герой - молодой ученый, который занимается конструированием роботов. Все действие представлено в виде фрагментов текста, большинство из которых предоставляет возможность выбрать один из нескольких вариантов развития событий. Они влияют на статистику главного героя (например, здоровье или богатство) и на характеристики его спутника-робота (автономность, боевая мощь, эмпатия...). 

До этой игры я относилась к жанру "Choose your own adventure" несколько предвзято - книги этого типа на русском языке, которые мне попадались, были написаны не слишком интересным язком и ориентировались скорее на внешний сюжет и статистику персонажа, а прохождение заключалось в нахождении самого "правильного" варианта. Choice of Robots от таких книг разительно отличается. Единственное "но" - нужно знать английский язык, причем на неплохом уровне (несколько раз пришлось отвлекаться на поиск в интернете перевода слов, значений технических терминов, источников цитат... но для меня это еще одно достоинство игры, поскольку в остальном чтение сложностей не доставило). 

Одно прохождение-прочтение заняло около 3 часов. 

Существеные особенности: 
- Нет возможности вернуться к предыдущей странице, если результ выбора чем-то не понравился. Даже если вы случайно кликнули не на тот вариант или недопоняли его смысл. Выбор сделан и вам дальше с этим жить)) Это очень усиливает впечатление от игры: местами психологическое напряжение выше, чем в иных "обычных" РПГ со звуком и графикой. Хорошо, что хоть время на размышление не ограничено. 

- Игрок "конструирует" не только себя (что характерно для любой РПГ), но и своего спутника-робота. Для меня уникальность Choice of Robots именно в этом - робот является самостоятельным персонжем, с которым игрокв ведет постоянный диалог, но при этом можно сильно повлиять на то, каким он будет.  

- Много текста. Я ожидала, что при втором прочтении большую часть страниц можно пролистывать, так как их содержание будет уже известно, но нет: меняются мелкие детали, меняется поведение персонажей, могут появиться целые новые эпизоды. Далеко не всегда можно вычислить, что именно послужило причиной этих изменений. Почему в первый раз робот не спросил у меня, как называть меня - Master или Sensei, а во второй спросил? Что произойдет, если из двух одновременно поступивших на телефон звонков выбрать другой? Если сбросить оба? Какой жесткий диск лучше выбрать для робота? Как повлияет на его характер, если его обучение будет состоять из игры в Braid? 

Даже при повторном прочтении, когда основной сюжет уже известен, и можно поставить себе цель раскрыть конкретную концовку, игра остается захватыавющей, поскольку "подходящие" варианты неочевидны. Прочитала два раза, в планах, как минимум, еще два, а может и больше. 

Не знаю, насколько хороши другие продукты Choice of Games (вряд ли настолько же), но при случае посмотрю и их (благо, с демо-версиями порядок, и можно оценить, насколько нравится стиль конкретного текста). Но это игра - не просто понравилась, а попала для меня в разряд шедевров. Тем, кого не пугает большой объем текста на английском языке, отсутствие музыки (но всегда ведь можно включить подходящий саундтрек в плеере) и иллюстраций (отлично написаный текст плюс ваше воображение это с лихвой кмпенсирует) игра однозначно придется по вкусу.

author: {'steamid': '76561198111714632', 'num_games_owned': 160, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 424, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 424, 'last_played': 1438562113}

Also, just in case someone from Choice of Games is reading this, _please_ make a Choice of Robots 2. Or at least a DLC. I would love to see more of this game's world, maybe beyond Chapter 7.

author: {'steamid': '76561197990923746', 'num_games_owned': 993, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 660, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 133, 'last_played': 1605123253}
review:
This is an incredibly deep and fascinating game. I truly felt concern for each of the characters during certain moments of the story, and the ending was incredibly satisfying. It also tackled the genuine issues of emergent robotics and their role in the world and society over the next century.
I am really, truly glad I played it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198033419637', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 103, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 103, 'last_played': 1421405900}
review:
I've had sad endings, and I've had happy endings. I grasped at eternal life, and even watched it drain away from between my fingers. I did my best to rule, and I did my best to love. With all things considered it made me question my mortallity and wish even more in real life for singularity. For life unending. I wish this dream to be true, life with out the risk of death. for we gasp at the great unknown and all hope that we carry on some how, where some simply respect that functionallity just ends, that we just shut down. I do not want to accept this, and I wish that I never experience death. To say that it terrifies me is an understatement. I want to see mankind's journy to the stars, I want to witness our first contact with intelegent life outside of our world. But in a way I don't want to just copy my memories, I wish to experience indefinitely, I know that with time I would forget the past, memories so dear to me fading away... but hopefully in the same respects I would make new memories, and hopefully people I hold dear and close join me as simply intellectual, and then perhaps oneday in physical bodies again. 

It's just that I simply don't want to say goodbye, this world is so beautiful, and we have only scratched the surface of what's outside of our own world. I wish to see it all, but I don't want to be trapped. I want to be free, alive, experiencing, feeling, loving, for as long as the stars flicky in the nights sky.

author: {'steamid': '76561198080633487', 'num_games_owned': 192, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 383, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 348, 'last_played': 1612832571}
review:
Совершенно новый для меня жанр. Удивительно и неожиданно интересно. Текст захватил меня с самого начала. Интересное описание с долей юмора и ОГРОМНОЙ свободной выбора, дающее фору многим графически полноценным играм.

10 из 10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198053428824', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 275, 'playtime_forever': 1222, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 399, 'last_played': 1605860680}
review: A very interesting game.  Not the kind i've played before but i was looking for something different. Played it through three times just to see some different endings, and discovered not only the possible endings change, but also the middle and late game story as well.  My first play through i chose to be as "good" as possible and found the ending very suitting.  Then i tried for something a bit more militaristic  for my second play through and was decidely unhappy with the ending (though it was true to the choices i made).  My last play through was As Myself, and strangely enough the ending was similar to the first play through but with some noticable differences that seemed to reflect in game alot of my real life situation (like being broke lol) Im sure there is alot of game content left to explore if im willing to make some different choices, but im content to leave it be.  In real life we cant walk down every road we encounter, and must content ourselfs with the choices we have made.  All and all i find that this is an excellent short game at just the right price and highly recomend it to anyone who wants to try something different.

author: {'steamid': '76561197984908006', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 504, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 395, 'last_played': 1626789454}
review:
This is my favourite of the 'Choice of Games' games I've played, while it's much shorter than most of the others it has a lot of variety and the story changes dramatically based on your choices.

Get involved with the war against China or stay out of it completely, its possible to stop the war from even happening in the first place!

Build a robot for war, or for love, (heck one option that you can get is to build sexbots!) legalise human-robot marriage, you can even have a cult around your robot.

Conquer the world and rule it as a dictator, or have your robots infiltrate society and get humans to accept them as their rulers.

While there are some glitches in some of the choices (like building your factory in China has no negatives in the war against China) this is by far one of the best text-based game I've ever played.

author: {'steamid': '76561198046424492', 'num_games_owned': 411, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 668, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 391, 'last_played': 1470860767}
review:
Это - образцовая РПГ. Сюжет мне очень близок по духу. В этой игре выбор действия/реплики сказывается не на цвете концовки, но полностью и частично меняет последующий сюжет: выбрав на 5 этапе вариант 2 (из 4), изменинтся ситуация на этапах 6, 10, 11, 20, 30, 100 и т.д. Страшно представить - сколько всего текста было написано в этой игре, и, полагаю, единичное прохождение затронет только 10% написанного. 
На данный момент я нахожусь на пути развития своей собственной фирмы как производителя медицинских роботов, или что-то типа того. 
Всё на английском, но читается достаточно легко. 
Очень лампово. 
12из10

Обновлено 14.01.15:

Я "прошел" игру. Никогда прежде меня так не завдевала ни одна книга и ни одна компьютерная игра. Я сделал много не очень правильных решений, но в жизни не всё зависит от нас самих, быть может, здесь и не могло быть правильного пути, но в конце было очень сложно "платить" за свой выбор. А в конце своей "жизни" решил, что мало сделал глупостей, и сглупил так, что теперь очень тяжело на душе... А ведь это всего-лишь текст.

Пройду еще несколько раз, попытаюсь найти свой хэппи-энд.

Обновлено:
 Я сделал все правильно. Ну почти.
https://www.dropbox.com/s/d8ir22lishfwimq/choice%20of%20robots.txt?dl=0

author: {'steamid': '76561198169733375', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 1332, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1261, 'last_played': 1419976974}
review:
Choice of Robots shows that text-based CYOA games can be fun and addicting. In CoR, your choices define the story; there is no illusion of choice. Your choices have impact and they will make a difference. As such, CoR is definitely worth two or more playthroughs because you'll get vastly different situations and events each time.

The choices you get are interesting and thought-provoking enough that it's almost always guaranteed you'll find one you like. Oftentimes, they are just downright tough. However, CoR is very forgiving in that if you do happen to make a less-than optimal decision, you can just continue right on because the resulting consequences are just as interesting. I would not recommend you to restart the game because that is unnecessary. You'll also get many backdoor options that you can fall back on if you choose to.

For your first playthrough, you shouldn't be paying too much attention to the stats. And don't try to guess what the author wants or what the "right" answer is, because this is your story. Just sit back and enjoy the ride by making choices as you see fit.

author: {'steamid': '76561198003885897', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 349, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 148, 'last_played': 1422131696}
review:
I'm not going to call this a game, because it's not.  This is a book.   
A very well written book; possibly the BEST interactive story I have ever read.  
I'm not a fan of choose-your-own-adventure type books.  
I'm not a fan of graphic novels.
This is so much more while being made up of a lot less...does that make sense?

Excellent character development, the plot is a solid sci-fi type that didn't have any glaring plot holes.  The hinted at stat bonuses that carry into what is successful and what fails to work feels balanced.  

This is very much worth the $5 price tag.  
My first read through took about an hour and a half, starting my second, even picking a slightly different choice seems drastically change the story to the point where I feel like I'm reading a different book.

review:
