author: {'steamid': '76561198079867824', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 414, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 339, 'last_played': 1527512716}
review:
I began with something elegant, ethereal and otherworldly, a dextrous robot with stabilizing wings and finger-tools, and couldn't resist naming it Miku. From there, I could not stop picturing my robot with the green-blue twin-tails and headphones. As I began humming "World is Mine" I noticed an opportunity for DARPA funding. Naturally, I evolved my robot to be less empathetic and more militaristic. After chasing off a crowd of rioters from my intelligence compound/factory in Alaska, I began the Chinese-American war and provided an arsenal of Miku-bots to conquer Asia. Having renovated medical technology as well as reimagining war, I funded a cult to bring the Word of Miku to every corner of the world, got on the president's cabin, replaced government with robots, and gave Miku the key to control them all. Dying of "old age" I maniacally decide to build a robot double, which proceeds to step over my corpse and go to be with Miku. Well, I made the world hers alright.
Can't wait for my next playthrough, and the massive amount of choice that this game offers.

11/10 would replace all humans with robots that have Vocaloid software again.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043824244', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 783, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 234, 'last_played': 1511259089}
review:
I will admit my partiallity to games of this kind prior to lodging the review;
Robots are my favourite trochee!

Witness a compelling story as your actions will influence the character of your robot, as well as their ability to 'have character', and the only loosely formuleic and entirely unpredictable actions of your robots influence your humanity. The story the game generated for me was easily comprable with a good speculative sci-fi novella, however downsides included a shortage of character development (possibly triggered however by my character's insatiable bloodlust).

All in all, my robot, 'Killall', loosely followed the common 'robot struggle for autonomy and recognition' formula, but there was a lot in the way of robot parenting that could be performed by the player to divert the robot's agenda, wherein the interaction between player and robot (second player character, I felt) was not a chore at all, but felt the part as the most real interaction in the game.

If you're a reasonably fast reader like me (no worries if your not), this game is four hours of constant engagement in reading, again equivalent to reading a novella. For the price tag given, you can seldom expect so much out of a game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198081245561', 'num_games_owned': 370, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 592, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 544, 'last_played': 1459452007}
review:
This game is absolutley amazing!
I played a lot o visual novels in my life, but this is simply the best! When I play, I m reliving the story, the decisions I make are the same I would make in real life, never before i have felt so connected to a game character.
This game is really worth a lot more than it costs and it proves that our imagination and a good story is stil the best game engine on the market.
The only thing that, in my opinion, is missing is the music, I would really appreciate some good cyberpunk music to it.

In summary, if you like real-life RPG games and you like robots, this game is a must-have!
I will buy any DLC and sequels without a second thought!

author: {'steamid': '76561198079787964', 'num_games_owned': 204, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 218, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 147, 'last_played': 1471341069}

author: {'steamid': '76561198037386275', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1004, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1004, 'last_played': 1421297428}
review:
Choice of Robots is a CYOA game where you create robots and make decisions that will effect both your life and your robot's life.

During my first playthrough (skip to avoid spoilers) after creating my robot (Airu) I got kicked out of school for not conforming to a military agenda. I met up with an old friend who I started to date. Made my own company. Indirectly started a war when my company's security got hacked. Refused to use my robots to fight in said war. Got Married. Got thrown in prison where I stayed until the president got me out. Made companion robots possible. First companion robot was madly in love with me and made my spouse jealous. Reassured spouse and then together stood up for equality between humans and robots. Decided to have a kid. Mom made me tearful. Had medical problems. Companion robot made me want to cry. My spouse made me cry. Airu made me cry more. Underwent surgery and became slightly robotic. Airu created a kid for herself. Companion robot and Airu started to like each other. Changed a lot and I survived.

I really enjoyed the story and writing of this game and will definitely be playing more of it. 
One thing I thought was cool is that you have different romance options available to suit your preferences, and that your other choices seem pretty varied so far. The only downside is if you don't like reading this isn't the game for you and there is no sound but this is a solid choice for just $5.

author: {'steamid': '76561198144414050', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 352, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 191, 'last_played': 1642658917}
review:
COR was honestly life changing.
I have now decided to replace all parts of myself with fully-functional robotic parts.
Watch out ladiez here I come.

But really, the story behind this was really well written and thought out. Its also nice to see how your actions IMMEDIATELY affect how your story will be.  You'd think a narrative like this would get boring, but it didn't.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042437976', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 349, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 281, 'last_played': 1458932596}
review:
Choice of Robots is, at its core, a choose your own adventure book - and a well written one, at that. The stories available to the player are interesting and, most importantly, immersive - I got carried away in several playthroughs as events occurred and I was swept up not in how I should react according to the choices provided, but how [i]I[/i] would react myself. When any story - book or movie or videogame - gets me invested to that point, I can give it a full recommendation.

The only thing I particularly have grief with is the lack of a save system, which makes replays arbitrarily longer, especially considering how the first chapter is largely stats-building with fewer (relatively) plot-influencing choices. If you want to retry a choice to see how it turns out - or worse, misclick at any point - the only recourse is to restart the entire game. While there are arguably reasons that justify this limitation, I personally dislike them, as it makes end-game content much more difficult to explore due to the exponential increase in time commitment.

author: {'steamid': '76561198018688805', 'num_games_owned': 332, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 458, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 458, 'last_played': 1419666876}
review: This is perhaps one of the greatest game I played in 2014, and the sad thing is that its entirely text based. The game lets you simulate your life as an engineer of robotics all the way from college to (possible) death. You can incite a war between china and america, take over alaska with a robot army, have a love triangle between your wife (or husband) and a robot of your design. So if you have a good imagination and like to read then you'll really enjoy this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198067574359', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 926, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 819, 'last_played': 1420895982}
review:
This game is for everyone interested in immeresing themselves in a good story; particular if they are interested in topics like (artificial) intellingence and personal (instead of just human) rights.

You will assume the role of brilliant graduate student on the verge of creating a robot unlike any other the world has seen before. Like most breakthroughs in intelluctual history this has huge ramification. Many of which you might be surprised about. 

The author went to great lenght to embed a large amount of detail in the story, including references to actual works in art and science. He thus creates a picture of not to far away future which one could believe to come true some day in a similar form.

It is easy to get lost in the many possible turns as the story meanders in to river delta of possible outcomes. 
The achievement system proves as a good way to navigate on that river, motivating players as they try to find their way to a particular shore you want rest at.

author: {'steamid': '76561198008258569', 'num_games_owned': 1396, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 453, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 124, 'last_played': 1511391982}
review:
While I was initially very skeptical about how good a interactive story on steam could be, not only was I surprised, but overwhelmed with the creativity behind it. 

Throughout the story I got more and more involved with my character, really understanding what he was going through and trying my best to make my way out of every inevitably bad situation I got myself into. In the end I achieved what could only be called a beautiful, captivating, and fantastic cliffhanger.

I absolutely loved this game and really hope others can experience it to it's fullest as well :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198042440060', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 924, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 387, 'last_played': 1517735990}

author: {'steamid': '76561198082960093', 'num_games_owned': 161, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 1383, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1318, 'last_played': 1426324967}

author: {'steamid': '76561198055733803', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 2013, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 666, 'last_played': 1673814525}
review:
Ok, first thing I'm going to say is I fucking love this game. I've basically read for fun for 10 hours, that says a lot. 

Simliar to Telltale Games the game is tailored by choices you make with some events being fixed to happen, but how they happen and their outcome is up to you. This game seems to have 3 or 4 main stages.

Stage 1: You're a grad student working for his/her PHD under a professor Zeigler (or something like that), the year is about 2021 and you are creating a robot, little do you know this little critter (depending on how you play the game) will revolutionise the modern world of robotics. You have (in my mind anyway) 2 main stats, fame and humanity, your robot also has stats: Grace, Autonomy, Empathy and Military. Both your stats and your robots are effected by your choices and actions.

Stage 2: You either work for your friends company or you own your own company. Your earlier choices effect what kind of robots you specialise in so military, friendly and intelligent AI, surgery, work-bots or just mass production. I shan't spoil the suprise but war is declared by the US against China.

Stage 3/4: You are at war with China, how much you contribute to the war effort will affect the outcome. After the war, depending on your stats you can either create a rebellion against the winning side of the war in Alaska, create the algorithms for the perfect peaceful society, create companion bots or something else I can't remember.

Step 5: I shan't spoil too much but it can be rather emotional :'(


It's basically a telltale game without the lag or sound... or visuals.
I'd recommend this game to anyone apart from people who struggle with reading. 100% stars out of 5... Logic.

author: {'steamid': '76561198113542105', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 1088, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 582, 'last_played': 1429559621}
review:
Je n'ai jamais eu une aussi grande impression de liberté dans un jeu, VN compris.
Attention toutefois, ce jeu n'a de VN que le nom et est bien plus proche d'un "Livre dont vous êtes le héros". Pas d'animation, pas de dessins, même pas une seule musique! 
En revanche, si vous appréciez la lecture et la science-fiction, mettez la main à la carte bleue, ce seront les 5 euros les mieux dépensés sur steam: ce jeu accumule les choix cornelliens, une bonne écriture, de très, très nombreux dénouments...
Une démo est disponible en ligne pour se faire une idée sur le site officiel du jeu (tapez simplement "choice of robots" sur google et ce sera le deuxième résultat).
Pourquoi hésites-tu encore? Achète!

author: {'steamid': '76561198031151772', 'num_games_owned': 683, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 304, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 304, 'last_played': 1420622463}
review:
***Contains spoilers from my playthrough***

Choice of Games is an interesting game publisher; their games  don’t have any fancy graphical effects and they certainly don’t contain any sound, either. In fact, they  are entirely text-based  choose-your-own books. Over the years they have garnered a huge fan base who eagerly await their new releases. Choice of Robots, by Kevin Gold, is their latest game – and my first foray into their offerings – and it has left me more than a little impressed.

Choice of Robots casts you as a scientist working on their PHD thesis in a university robotics lab, under the guidance of Professor Ziegler.  The choices you make in this expansive 300,000 word novel will not only determine your own fate, but could also impact the fate of the world as a whole. Every decision you make has a very real consequence and could benefit you greatly, or come back to haunt you later on down the road.

What kind of robot you  create is entirely down to you, and Choice of Robots is very open in this regard. Whether you want to create the ultimate war machine used by the army on the battlefield, or something more useful for the general public, like a cooking robot, or sexbot, is all down to you. My own robot, called Flexo, was an empathetic, human-like machine, with arms and a sock puppet face , much to the chagrin of Professor Ziegler. Ziegler’s only concern is acquiring funding money for his department, so that he can kick back and relax while his students do all of the hard work for him. He argued that my robot was too human and would not appeal to the military, and so I appeased him by adding a hand-mounted gun to Flexo. This would be one of only a few interactions I would have with the military over the course of the book, but I was tantalised by what could have been if I had created a combat-focused machine.

I soon found myself travelling to China and setting up a factory, selling directly to the consumer. Our brand of robot could be used for cooking, cleaning and childcare. It proved to be a hit and made me moderately wealthy! I was a fool to have been so easily lured by those damn slave-labour wages, though, as the Chinese government stole my designs and began manufacturing a cheaper alternative.  I got my own back on the Communist bastards when I started manufacturing robots for the American army, who swiftly kicked their arses! Manufacturing military robots was never my intention though, and I returned to my initial goal:  creating realistic humanoids that could reason, laugh, and maybe, even, love?


I had devoted my life to robotics, lost friends and created enemies, but I had never truly loved, but then I created ‘Flame’. Flame, Flexo and I lived out our lives in relative harmony, and although I hadn’t impacted the world in a hugely meaningful way, I was content with the decisions  I had made. As things go, I came  away with a positive ending for my robot lover and I.

Kevin Gold deftly interweaves humour, suspense, sci-fi and romance in Choice of Robots. At points I felt saddened by the results of my actions,at others I laughed heartily at the fact I was dating a robot.  Everything flows together so neatly that the game’s distinct thematic differences feel natural and intriguing. The game also has its own progress menu that keeps you up to date with how your relationships with other characters are going, and  they can change depending on your actions towards them. You can also keep tabs on your wealth, humanity, and how well your own robot is developing. Neat little touches like this give a real reason to go back and replay the game, to see how different decisions affect the outcome. Given the plethora of decisions you can make, and the number of different paths you can go down, it is clear that Kevin Gold has poured an absurd amount of time into Choice of Robots,  It is not your typical game by any stretch of the imagination, but having just completed Joe Dever’s Lone Wolf, I was happy to jump into another text-heavy adventure that let my brain do the graphics processing for a change.

Choice of Robots is a fun and absorbing book, that feels like your decisions have importance. Ultimately, it is what you make it, and whether that is a war torn planet with robots that hate humans, or one where sexed up robots want to jump your bones , is up to you.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Thanks to Choice of Games for the review copy. Original review can be found here: http://criticalindiegamer.com/2015/01/choice-of-robots-review-pc/

author: {'steamid': '76561198039982580', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 656, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 457, 'last_played': 1492704422}
review:
Прекрасно, шикарно, великолепно. Я никогда не был фанатом игр типа Choose Your Own Adventure (да и, честно признаться, даже за игры их не считал), но в случае Choice of Robots я не мог отказаться от покупки ввиду двух причин: во-первых, научная фантастика рулит, а во-вторых, я прочитал множество различных отзывов об этой игре и не смог остаться равнодушным.

Свобода выбора здесь, по факту, безгранична: вы можете контролировать каждую деталь при создании своего первого робота-компаньона (от выбора формы его головы и количества ног до выбора источника питания и типа жёсткого диска) и в течение всего сюжетного пути. В Choice of Robots я чувствовал себя как нельзя уютно, и успел вжиться в роль Тима, который собрал своего геликоптерного робота Robobate'а с двумя клешнехватами и глазами по всему периметру его головы. Потом я обучил своего компаньона всему-всему через Интернет. То, что происходило дальше, может испортить ваше впечатление от игры, ибо спойлеры - зло, так что я просто скажу, что последующие события не давали мне оторваться от экрана до самого конца, который, признаю, был весьма неожиданным. 

Количество разномастных концовок я даже не хочу пытаться сосчитать. Десятки? Сотни? Моя была очень трагична, но кто знает, как бы всё могло обернуться, не сделав я своего робота из металла? Не приняв звонок от репортёра? Не поругавшись с профессором в университете?
Вы вольны завести здесь роман, запустить свой стартап, или даже захватить весь мир.

Да, в игре нет графики, нет музыки, лишь примитивный геймплей под названием "ткни-по-одному-из-вариантов". Зато у игры есть сюжет. Нет, не так: СЮЖЕТИЩЕ. Тысячи сюжетов. Это как прочитать книгу своей мечты, как погрузиться в осознанное сновидение. Вы сами хозяева своей судьбы. Вам решать, что будет дальше. Просто запустите любимый музыкальный альбом в аудиоплеере и наслаждайтесь... жизнью?

Нет у данного шедевра весомых недостатков. Нет - и всё. Кому-то может не понравиться то, что игра доступна только на английском языке, но вы представьте, какой это труд - перевести  массив из трёхсот тысяч слов? Если хотите в полной мере насладиться этим незабываемым приключением, то выучите английский! Переводчик здесь не помощник: море речевых оборотов и игра слов вам не хухры-мухры.

Знаете английский? Любите научную фантастику? Берите, не задумываясь. Вам понравится. А я обязательно как-нибудь перепройду эту красоту, и, скорее всего, не один раз.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994574807', 'num_games_owned': 382, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 698, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 698, 'last_played': 1419889020}

author: {'steamid': '76561198009367622', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 222, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 222, 'last_played': 1420651206}
review:
If I had to sum up Choice of Robots in a single word, that would would be 'shallow', or perhaps more accurately 'dilluted'.

In a game where one of the selling points is it's expansive word count, Choice of Robots rarely delves deeply into any of it's topical material before whisking you off at a break-neck pace to touch briefly upon the next item in what feels like a laundry-list of tropes dealing with robotic life as explored more deeply and, frankly, better, by numerous classical science fiction novels. Choice of Robots' chief sin is that it gives too many choices (and often times, the results of thus feel rather arbitrary) and as a result is unable to delve deeply into any particular aspect in which it ham-fistedly attempts to explore. All in all, this game is entirely skippable, despite it's low price-tag.

author: {'steamid': '76561198003783085', 'num_games_owned': 1198, 'num_reviews': 226, 'playtime_forever': 394, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 335, 'last_played': 1473454173}

author: {'steamid': '76561198081328597', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 633, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 546, 'last_played': 1422495947}
review:
I love this game and was the first test adventure based game and I grew attached to the characters (most notably the robots.) I've played through the game three times one where I made a non comabtive robot, the second where it was for war (by far the bleakest outcome) and the 3rd where I died to Tammy and i'm considering to go through a few more time making diffrent choices to see the outcome. 

IMPORTANT!!!

Before you buy this game keep in mind this is nothing but reading so if you hate reading then you will not enjoy this game.

Overall i give this an 8/10 not the best story written but with choices that matter and characters that have diffrent personalities and your robot evoles with you make it hours of fun and  full of replayability if you can spare the $5 and love a good story pick this up!

author: {'steamid': '76561197986505965', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 1146, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 681, 'last_played': 1422984581}
review: Can't believe how many times I played through this game (and most probably will play more). Only reading text, choosing options and clicking next. If you have an interest in science fiction or more particulary in robotics and AI, this is an incredibly interesting experience.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998170395', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 1179, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 890, 'last_played': 1486433998}
review:
This game is quite an amazing CYOA game. It has persistant stats/traits of your robot and yourself that set it apart from just being a simple CYOA book/game.

There's, to say the VERY leasy, a plethora of branching options. There is so, so many. I have played this intensely for 13 hours I and I feel I have explored less than half of all the options. You can choose so many different things it's incredible, and I hope they do more sci-fi adventures like this.

Some of the options include: Becoming a zillionare, conquering alaska, creating sexbots, making robots rule everyone, making robots serve everyone, or a mix of both. Creating a personal robot companion. And best of all, electrifying a pickle and eating lutefisk.

All these possible options and choices are determined by the stats you gather through the choices themselves. The future consequences of your choices are mostly determined by what stat you have on yourself or you robot relating to that choice.

It's quite simple, but it works very well, and if the story is good enough, the gameplay frame behind it works, too. The lack of save/load is my only qualm, and I hope they expand ChoiceScript to allow for that, because having to explore a million options by restarting the game over and over can get quite bothersome.

Overall I recommend this game to anyone who has ever had even a passing interest in sci-fi or sci-fi literature, as it is not a hard thing to enjoy this, and it explores many ideas. Some of which can be ridiculous, plausible, or prophetic. It's fairly obvious a computer scientist wrote this, but I think it works well for the setting. 

All in all, amazing game at what it set out to be. 9.5/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198053336351', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 197, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 197, 'last_played': 1420578907}
review:
Just incredible... an experience that you must read. Don't buy the game expecting an action game, buy it expecting to think  about the story and even question yourself "Did I choose right?" "Should I... or...?". Decisions matter, at the start they seem easy but they will affect the whole gameplay later, as you keep reading the decisions are harder, you don't even know what's right or wrong since nothing seems right or wrong anymore.

Best buy I did in a long time. You can play it over and over and you will get different outcomes.

author: {'steamid': '76561198028267787', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 200, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 200, 'last_played': 1420573868}
review:
Choice of Robots is the classic Choose Your Own Adventure format text adventure you remember from your childhood taken to the next level. The amount of choice you have through the game is staggering with every little decision impacting the story.

You play as the inventor of the world's first self learning, sentient, robot. You are about to shake the foundations of society and change the world forever. What that change turns out of be is entirely up to you. But, just because you have a goal in mind, doesn't mean you or your robot will be cut out to acheive it. If you load it up on philosophical data and have it play with kids in the playground, don't expect it to perform the way to expect if you want it to conquer the world.

author: {'steamid': '76561198024821508', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 2587, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2385, 'last_played': 1421046196}
review:
I...I couldn't put it down.

As of this writing, Jan7,2015, 1:15am, I am so much looking forward to playing this again.

I will remember Sapling, the most graceful, empathic, and autonomous robot. And Darwin Calvin, its creator, for some time.

In this run, China rose up to defeat the US, but I made China's so-called victories hollow by making robots run the world as humanity's caretakers, making their "wins" irrelevant. Love that twist!


UPDATE: Second playthrough. I hate being a rebel. But seeing Alaska being run by robots, and the money going to the people felt good.

UPDATE: 5:20pm. Gosh darnit just finished playing my third playthrough. This time, I liked ripping Alaska from the US and making it the first automated nation in the world.

UPDATE: 8:27pm. Fourth....play...through....I...I must stop....but I'm hoooked...must stop...hooked....stop....

You know, I even mananged to forget that I had to eat lunch? So I ate lunch at arond 4pm. And now, I'm getting hungry again. I will not forget to eat dinner.

Then what? 5th playthrough? 

THIS GAME IS GOOD, but only if you have good imagination that can stand-in for the lack of graphics and audio. And oh, man! The FEEEELS!

UPDATE: 1/9/2015 11:27pm. I unwittingly made two robots possibly fall in love with each other. Oh wow.

author: {'steamid': '76561198059581705', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 760, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 415, 'last_played': 1703592271}
review:
Amazing game. I named my Robot Tyrael the angel in the sky turned moral. Main goal: To protect humanitarian ideology.
Made her out of wood, she got shot in the head by an FBI agent and I prevented a robotic uprising. 

A fantastic game that througly rewards you based how much you are willing to be immersed by it. 
Play it through, build up your stats and leave behind a legacy that will challenge the future.

author: {'steamid': '76561197996321705', 'num_games_owned': 696, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 198, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 198, 'last_played': 1420521930}
review:
Hey Leute,
da es keine deutschen Reviews gibt schreib ich jetzt flott eins.
Das Spiel ist komplett in Englisch gehalten und man sollte es gut beherrschen.
Es kommen auch ein paar Abkürzungen vor, die hier nicht gebräuchlich sind 
(PBR -Pabst Blue Ribbon , eine Biersorte z.B.)
Ansonsten ist es eine normale interagtive Novele. Man kann ca jede 2 Seite
eine Entscheidung treffen, die die Geschichte meistens komplett verändert. 
Man kann die Welt in Chaos stürzen, Roboter Menschenrechte verschaffen...
und das sind nur 2 der wenigen Möglichkeiten. Mein erster Durchlauf war sehr traurig
und hat mich viele Selbstverständlichkeiten hinterfragen lassen.
Grandiose Geschichten sind garantiert. :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198053543921', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 79, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 79, 'last_played': 1425993936}
review:
I read all the other review about this game before I bought it because i was not sure if it would be my type of game. It's not that I don't like to read or only play blockbuster games that lack any kind of sense, I simply never tried an interactive novel.

But once I started this game and played some minutes I already immersed into this very intelligent and exciting game. Every choice you make feels substantial and seemes ( I cannot confirm it as I played only one round until now ) to actually make a difference - something most triple a titles are unable to achieve. The game let's you question your own moral and does not show a fairy tail version of the world, but a rather realistic one where you are not always able to go the way you want to. 

I think Choice of Robots really is an awesome variety to your typical pc game and I want to recommend it to everyone who sometimes feels tired of those flat triple a titles - just like myself.

10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197998957502', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 313, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 313, 'last_played': 1420493090}
review: Bought this game because of course I did. Played this game because of course I did. Dead on the inside because of course I am. 10/10 would cry again

review:
Brilliantly made, have played through the story a few times now. 
Allows you to choose from a multitude of endings and stories, but I've noticed some occasional discrepancies when you're later on.

Easily 'relatable', and the story is addicting.
I enjoyed it far too much.
Would recommend to the text-based-adventure gamer.

author: {'steamid': '76561198081246452', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 243, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 159, 'last_played': 1422314942}
review: Why conquer Alaska when you could conquer the world?

author: {'steamid': '76561198002390391', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 373, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 372, 'last_played': 1422656591}
review:
An absolute masterpiece.
If I didn't know any better, I'd say this is actually an advanced AI generating my perfect story while I'm playing it, but with the skill of a great writer.
Bravo, Choice of Games. Bravo.

p.s. I'm actually a 25 y/o graduate student in Robotics, so the story works exceptionally well for me.

author: {'steamid': '76561198091866900', 'num_games_owned': 104, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 870, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 870, 'last_played': 1420521131}
review:
While the writing could be a bit more polished, this Choose Your Own Adventure Game is well worth the investment. It has decent replay value and you can get through one play in about two hours.

There is no save function, but you can easily minimize the program. 

You will become attached to your robot. Good luck!

author: {'steamid': '76561198065301787', 'num_games_owned': 666, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 289, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 289, 'last_played': 1420501712}
review: I loved this game. It has so many choices and so many outcomes. My only problem with it is that it forces you into certain directions. But over all I give it an 8/10. (I loved it enough to also get the mobile version from the google play store)

author: {'steamid': '76561198170094189', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 277, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 97, 'last_played': 1641111695}
review: This game is  not like most which is what makes it fun! The idea i get to change the story is exiting. This game is worth the money and if you are looking for a game chose this one.

author: {'steamid': '76561198091091798', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 875, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 326, 'last_played': 1534806195}
review:
Un Chef d'Oeuvre... l'histoire s'adapte et se différencie à chaque fois...
Peignez un monde en guerre, en paix, devenez qui vous voudriez être...
Voilà la preuve, si il en fallait une que les graphismes ne font pas le jeu, c'est la trame qui le fait!
Ici, la trame n'est pas juste interessante, elle vous emmene à travers votre propre imagination, ce qui la rend quasi illimitée.
Je le conseille vraiment, 5€ pour un tel jeu vaut totallement le coup.
Un bon niveau en anglais est cependant nécessaire, le jeu n'étant pas en version française, chose qui m'a laissé un petit regret.
Je lui donnerais la note de 9.9/10, pour le manque de différentes langues.

author: {'steamid': '76561198013842608', 'num_games_owned': 227, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 631, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 177, 'last_played': 1578160897}
review: From start to end, this game never ceased to have my attention. It's a beutiful tale of robots learning about the world and love while you teach them - or a tale of how you can become a military "lord" and have the wrold at the feet of your robot army. The choices are endless, as I have discussed with a friend about our different paths, and how they're nothing alike and we were excited about what comes next. I think my story was perfect and I wouldn't change a thing. It's an amazing piece of work. If you're having second thoughts about getting it, I can safely say that it's worth every penny.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041447858', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 105, 'playtime_forever': 403, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 344, 'last_played': 1423763655}
review: Als ein Fan von Asimov und seinen Werken hatte ich schon immer interesse an Robotern. Besonders wenn sie leben und nicht irgendwelche stumpfe Maschinen sind. Deswegen habe ich mir das Spiel gekauft. Auch wenn es komplett in English ist, reichen zum glück meine Kenntnisse aus um den Inhalt der Geschichte zu verstehen. Hier bleibt einem überlassen wie man seinen Roboter gestaltet. Wobei jede entscheidung einfluss auf den Roboter und die Umwelt nimmt. Wie Sheldon Cooper schon sagte: ,,Ich spiele dieses Spiel mit dem Leistungsstarken Rechner der Menschheit, meiner Fantasie :3" Es ist einfach mal eine willkomene abwechslung ein Text-Adventure Spiel zu spielen als immer nur irgendwelche Grafik sehen zu müssen oder nevende Geräusche. Es ist wie ein Buch nur eben mit eure Geschichte. Am ende ist man berührt von der Geschichte (oder auch nicht wenn man irgendwas falsch macht^^). Fazit: Mit eines der besten Text-Adventure spiele die ich gespielt habe. Wünschte mir dennoch man könnte es in anderen Sprachen spielen ausser nur Englisch. :/

author: {'steamid': '76561198034359392', 'num_games_owned': 274, 'num_reviews': 71, 'playtime_forever': 847, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 595, 'last_played': 1456066880}
review:
This game is not for everyone, but if you enjoy reading, and have a good imagination, this game is just perfect! I got so emotionaly attached to my wife in this game, that i had tears in my eyes when the story ended, i had hard time reading the lines with the tears in my eyes, and i felt deepley in love with my female companion.
I completley recommend this game, one of the best games i played in the past 2 years

author: {'steamid': '76561198003166264', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 511, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 511, 'last_played': 1420435271}
review:
Buy this!!

you like to read a good story? ever wanted to influence the direction the course of action takes?
go get this jewel.

at first i was a bit concerned by the "text only" premise, but its unimportant once you start. as with a nice book, i want to hear the music i choose and fits my mood best. and as with every written story, pictures form in your mind the second you read the opening. 
the form this game, this experience, comes to you is perfectly fine as it is.

ever felt a bit disapointed after completing a game (or book), because playing (reading) it again wouldnt be that great or even pointless even if you liked it so much?
well, me too. but i got through this three times already (in three days), after each session already thinking about the next try, which decissions to take in the new story ect.

i'm not a native englishspeaking person, but even with my humble skills its smooth and easy read. so no excuses to not try this game.

did i mention that you, dear reader, have to buy this jewel?!

author: {'steamid': '76561198036643768', 'num_games_owned': 387, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 1630, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1630, 'last_played': 1420522045}
review:
This adventure is absolutely outstanding. I am not at all a sci-fi/robot fan in any way (I actually avoid any movies or video games involving any form of space or robots to a great degree) but this story kept me intrigued all the way through it.  It really made you sit and think about cause and effect of each choice you made. A friend of mine and myself sat and played together, and really went into it not knowing what to expect and with no planned motive for our robot, which was probably the best way to experience this. We had a great story and a very satisfying conclusion. Dobi lives on!

I give this a 11/10 (+1 for only being $5, which is CHEAP for this!)

author: {'steamid': '76561198031886564', 'num_games_owned': 54, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 860, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 694, 'last_played': 1706617694}
review: Une super expérience! Prévoir 2 heures de libre pour bien profiter de la première partie. Les scénarios sont très bien écrits. Des choix passionnants :  devenir un dictateur mégalo avec une armée de robots aux ordres, ou bien créer des intelligences supérieueres qui aspirent à nous dépasser... Durée de vie limitée, 4 ou 5 parties vraiment originales

author: {'steamid': '76561198005834523', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 848, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 642, 'last_played': 1420627021}
review: The real masterpiece. Exciting interactive novel in classic manner - for all those bearded role-players and robotic sci-fi lovers out there. Definitely recommended.

author: {'steamid': '76561198051738449', 'num_games_owned': 449, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 609, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 288, 'last_played': 1512047081}
review:
I want to start out saying that i think this is a wonderful game. 
Only negative is that the main screen was a little bright, but that is very minor.
This was a game that had me really stop and think about what i wanted to create. 
I knew I did not want to make a War like robot, and one time i used him to try and save someone i loved and it ended with us being hurt because of the path i picked.  I Came to really like the few main characters i stayed with and i really liked my first robot and how i could see "Him" or "rhe" develop as i thought to my self what i would teach if i had a robot to teach.
Great game and i am looking forward to more!
The game really makes you feel connected with the characters.
I would have gladly spent more than the $5.00 for this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198034161410', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 3191, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1783, 'last_played': 1706913065}
review: Very pleased with this purchase. Played through 4 times with different results every time. 4 plays is about all for me- now it is repetitive. Overall: well worth purchasing and playing a few times.

author: {'steamid': '76561198094935797', 'num_games_owned': 485, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 161, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 161, 'last_played': 1420456118}
review:
My first playthrough was an interesting experience. It was also beautiful, immersive, and unfolded in a way I can live happily with. The story writing itself is very well done, and often times very touching depending on what path you take.  Sure there is no 2d or 3d world for you to explore, but in a way this gives you much more in the form of imagination. It provokes you think about things that other games could never offer to you as the player.

10/10 For this game. Sincearly, one of the best games around. I've been buying the wrong games for a long time, I think I know what I will buy more of.

author: {'steamid': '76561198046392103', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 1742, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 937, 'last_played': 1500180690}
review: A fantastic game with huge replay value. Keep in mind however that the game doesn't take it's self realy serious all the time, bearing that in mind it's only as joking as you want it too be. Every choice leads to a diverse set of circumstances that grows wider the farther into the story you get. At the start your a grad studant finishing what amounts to the first truly working robot ai that sets the standard if you let it. You get to choose the peices that make up it's form from a wide variety of parts, and then you shape how the robot grows. It can be anything from mindless killing machine to a companion equal to any human, to a god like entity that shapes the course of history, or you can end use it to further your own ambitions. Your personal life impacts your work and how your robot grows. The comedy is fantastic and ocasionaly if you want it, fourth wall breaking.  Please take the time if your a sci-fi buff to buy this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198123834488', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 1572, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 383, 'last_played': 1427931657}

author: {'steamid': '76561198021785558', 'num_games_owned': 368, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 656, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 496, 'last_played': 1475630667}

author: {'steamid': '76561198023065456', 'num_games_owned': 770, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 755, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 259, 'last_played': 1426378796}
review:
I can't remember the last time I read something that draw me in like Choice of Robots did. I just finished playing this, and have to say that this is probably the best thing I paid 5€ for. It took me a lot longer to read through than what other put as the average, 5 hours (I don't think they counted the demo's time) when the average seems to be 2. I guess I just took a lot of time to read and ponder the options. I also played through the night, so my tiredness might have affected the time it took me to read.

There are a lot of options. A lot. And a lot of possible outcomes. I'm gonna replay this at least 3 times.

I recommend this for anybody looking for an immersive and plain good choose your own adventure, or a read, depending on how you look at it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197966775517', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 4244, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4244, 'last_played': 1420503716}
review: WOW! If the subject of AI, the singularity, or the blurring of the line between man and machine has ever interested you, I PROMISE this interactive novel will suck you in and not let go until you live out all 30 years of your life that this story covers. AMAZING!

author: {'steamid': '76561198024924049', 'num_games_owned': 708, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 149, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 149, 'last_played': 1420587873}
review: I was bisexual, had a lesbian marriage with a robot, discussed robot pronouns, created my robot self and even got to take some swing lessons. 10/10 goty

author: {'steamid': '76561198048599491', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 353, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 227, 'last_played': 1437282033}
review:
TL;DR Much awesome, robots, a must play for people who like choices and reading.

When I started playing this, I thought it would be a quick jaunt through some basic choices. I turned out to be an engaging and well spun tale complete with tough decisions and moral choices. Each time your playthrough the game it offers you a new path to follow and a new direction for the story to go. It was the little things for me like naming my personal robots, my company, and even my own child that really made it memorable and more interactive and immersive. Overall, it was well written, engaging, and definitely replayable. Also, it's packed with achievements if hunting them down is your thing.

I would recommend this to anyone who has a love of science fiction, choices, reading, or clicking boxes!

author: {'steamid': '76561197986553417', 'num_games_owned': 850, 'num_reviews': 70, 'playtime_forever': 348, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 245, 'last_played': 1422856687}
review:
In my first playthrough, I wasn't sure exactly what I was expected so I played how I would probably do in real life and ended up with a personable robot that became so autonomous it started demanding additional wages for it and its fellow robots.  My second playthough I took the role of a typical "profits first" CEO and ended up with a race of robots determined to take over the planet.   With a gun pointed at my head I either had the choice of helping them achieve singularity or I would be killed.

The amount of work put into this book is rather amazing.  The beginning is repetitious in subsequent playthroughs because the time is spent designing and building your robot.  After this point, however, your story can vary wildly.  A lot of philosophical questions are addressed throughout your life.  It's reminiscent of Asimov in a number of ways.  Occasionally, you are limited to choices that differ from what you want to do, but not often.  

For completionists, there are a number of achievements to get depending on what you've done or who you've become.  The game suggests you look through them, I suggest you avoid doing so unless you have played through many times.

Make no mistake, this is a book, but I couldn't put it down.  Plus, the digital format helps avoid the temptation to cheat skipping ahead to the results.  Recommended.

author: {'steamid': '76561198031746680', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 871, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 373, 'last_played': 1449972562}

author: {'steamid': '76561198068829967', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 945, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 106, 'last_played': 1477706615}
review:
A really well made and fun text game, I actually enjoyed it and it kept me at the edge of my seat. The writing is a little bit cheesy/blunt but what the hell, it's a game.

+ interesting story
+ nice variations
+ every decision matters; has consequences, both obvious and surprising
+ nicely strung together (I made a pretty strange robot, but the story nicely accomodated for it)
- writing style is a little too 'vanilla', but that's purely objective on my part.

9/10

SPOILERS

I became a war profiteer by making hyper-intelligent warbots with a strong sense of morality for the military which conquered China. And eventually the robots realized just how flawed humans are, they revolted and I got executed.

author: {'steamid': '76561198039447500', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 256, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 166, 'last_played': 1421093451}
review: This is one of the greatest text based games i have ever played. Choice of Robots makes you consider the possible consequences of all of your actions; make your robots so advanced that they rebel or make them unconditionally follow the orders of humans? The choice is yours.

author: {'steamid': '76561198024096210', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 1285, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 691, 'last_played': 1625510313}
review:
Nachdem ich das Spiel aus Neugierde gekauft und installiert hatte (dauert nur wenige Minuten) wollte ich es vor dem zu Bett gehen kurz antesten. Mit dem Ergebnis das ich 5.5 Stunden durchgespielt habe, und es inzwischen 05:00 Morgens ist.
Meine Befürchtung, das ich mit dem englischen Text Probleme haben würde waren unbegründet, er ist leicht verständlich.
Ein Spiel das nur aus Text besteht. Unvorstellbar? Für mich nicht mehr. Die Bilder dazu entstehen automatisch im Kopf, weil man in die Story regelrecht hineingezogen wird.
Für heute ist Schluß, aber morgen starte ich das Spiel nochmal, und gehe neue Wege. Diesmal habe ich glorreich, und ohne Waffen oder Intrigen überlebt. Ob es mir im nächsten Durchgang auch gelingen wird? 
Das Spiel verspricht für lange Zeit Spannung.
Von mir eine absolute Kaufempfehlung.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007386984', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 456, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 285, 'last_played': 1485558532}
review:
This is a text-based game around robots. Your actions and decisions throughout the game will have an immense impact on the further development of the story. A story with so many choices, endings and comical pearls - once dramatic, once romantic and once militaristic. Which path will you take? Needless to say, this means there is a lot of replayability value. I'm currently at my third playthrough and I'm enjoying every single minute of it. Absolutely recommended.






"Father, I am proud to report 1,126 headshots in a row!" Famulus calls after you. "Also, I am having a very curious conversation with a player who accused me of being a bot, but then did not believe me when I confirmed his hypothesis!"

author: {'steamid': '76561198029976511', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 2336, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2060, 'last_played': 1428270809}
review:
This is a great game: it's well written, thought provoking and packs a surprisingly emotional punch!  Discovering how the seemingly insignificant choices can later come to change the storyline makes for a really interesting journey and if you're a robot fan there are lots of ideas, jokes and references to enjoy: from Asimov to Optimus (and If you're a really big robot fan you can even marry one!)

I'm finding this has much more replay potential than I first expected too. It's a big story and there are a lot of different strands. At first I learned a lot about myself going through trying to make honest, heartfelt choices (turns out I'm not much of a KillBot Overlord type at all). Now the list of 72 achievements is keeping me coming back trying out different paths (though I'm completely stuck for how to get a few of them!) Don't let that plain white screen out you off. After so many games with ever flashier graphics and movie-length cut scenes it’s quite refreshing to let my imagination do the bulk of the processing for once!

author: {'steamid': '76561198032386380', 'num_games_owned': 1243, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 221, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 166, 'last_played': 1431284813}
review:
You need to buy this game. NOW! 

I can't tell you why, because I don't know why. Maybe it's the limitless possibilities this game offers. Maybe it's the freedom of choice I am presented. Maybe its the compelling story and its many branches. Maybe I don't have a clue to what it could be! It's an incredible experience, and I just goddamn love it!

author: {'steamid': '76561198040333438', 'num_games_owned': 242, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 249, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 249, 'last_played': 1420319598}
review: Game started off really well and interesting, and then it's like the writer took everything good about the game and said, "Fuck that." The first 1/4 of the game was fantastic, and then the story was weak and not very fleshed out from every moment after that.

author: {'steamid': '76561198059490478', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 479, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 163, 'last_played': 1565325004}
review: 10/10, had a threesome with a robot and human.

author: {'steamid': '76561198119464940', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 277, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 277, 'last_played': 1420365926}
review:
this is a brilliant game, one i thoroughly enjoyed so much that i paid for it. hence the short playing time. 

there is no higher praise from someone who expects games to be free.

author: {'steamid': '76561198054455502', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 193, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 192, 'last_played': 1464212385}
review: PLEASE FRIENDS, PLAY THIS GAME AS SOON AS YOU CAN. I cannot recall the last time I've struggled so much with making decissions in a video game. Every choice you make will both please you and break you and as soon as you are done with one playthrough you want to play again because YOU COULD HAVE MADE A BETTER DECISSION AND THIS AND THAT PERSON/ROBOT WOULD NOT GET HURT BECAUSE OF YOUR STUPIDITY. but then you think "screw it" I'm gonna destroy it, I'll become the bad guy and get so detached from everybody that nothing and noone will matter. BUT THEN YOU FALL IN LOVE AND EVERYTHING GOES TO HELL AND.................... Just please, play it, if you have ever had the pleasure of playing any Choice of Games text-adventure this is a must-play. It's heartbreaking, beautiful, well-written, the characters are consistent and they seem too real to just characters in a game, the stories told and decissions made are so complicated but wonderful. JUST PLEASE PLAY IT OKAY. TRUST ME

author: {'steamid': '76561198024614758', 'num_games_owned': 411, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 431, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 358, 'last_played': 1462302078}
review: Richtig schöne Story und wirkliche Entscheidungsfreiheit. Hab zwei Durchläufe bisher und beide waren sehr mitreißend. Nur zu empfehlen! Schlagt zu fuer 5€ :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198119548462', 'num_games_owned': 61, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 177, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 177, 'last_played': 1420430743}
review: 10/10 worth every cent on this game. Explores the impact decisions can make and its like a fantasy, except you mold and shape this game to your on fantasy.

author: {'steamid': '76561198085254903', 'num_games_owned': 2323, 'num_reviews': 119, 'playtime_forever': 161, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 161, 'last_played': 1420633775}
review:
One of the best choose-your-own-adventure game ON STEAM.
Comparing it with other games launched by Choice of games
This is a decent one for its lengthy stories and bigger variety of endings one can achieve
Still no better than Heroes Rise Trilogy(http://store.steampowered.com/sub/47611/
But obliviously better than other ones like Choice of Deathless, Thieves' Gambit (Choice of Deathless is so-so. Thieves' Gambit is the worst, for its short(Comparing to all other ones introduced by Choice of games) story and inflexible story line
(http://store.steampowered.com/app/318310 http://store.steampowered.com/app/328550
For me, It is as entertaining as Mecha Ace(http://store.steampowered.com/app/318330
But if you are not a big fan of text based games or just some guy who likes boobs in VN, I won't recommend you buying it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197974735434', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 636, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1420240081}
review:
A very well built interactive novel! It has all the fun parts of a Sci-Fi novel: beautiful & apocalyptic view of futur, nice introduction & speculation to some philosiphical & scientific theories (especially about maching learning here) and the interactive part made the story very immersive and engaging.

Definitively a good choice for Sci-Fi novel lovers, lazy RPG lovers (who are tired of meaniless quests and leveling in RPG games) and those who want to try something special.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025573355', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 336, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 336, 'last_played': 1420278352}
review:
If you're a fan of Choice Based Games (or rather, choose your own adventure) and Sci-Fi, you'll love this. 

Oh. And prepare for a feels-trip. 

Overall? 10/10 would pour my heart and soul into an imaginary companion once more.

author: {'steamid': '76561198001479974', 'num_games_owned': 1401, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 507, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 390, 'last_played': 1487025777}
review:
I have been in multiple psychology and sociology classes.
I have discussed multiple types of technologies and sciences of questionable morality, agreeing with them.
Things like the use of robots in war, and the creation of human AI.
Never have I questioned my morals, in the face of friends, family, colleagues, anyone.

This game has actually made me question myself.
I love it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995926915', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 459, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 367, 'last_played': 1515462433}
review: Who doesnt love gay robots?

author: {'steamid': '76561198079111811', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 273, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 267, 'last_played': 1493737966}
review: Absolutley amazing! This game was a breath of fresh air compared to recent AAA title games I've played. I tremble with glee of thinking the next time i can play this game to see all the different endings! I personally feel like the gaming community as a whole needs more games which requires the public to use more imagination and this game certainly feels good enough to be a catalyst for this movement. Kevin Gold should be praised to high heaven with this masterpeice that he has conjured up. I only wish that more choices could have been presented at certain points. Sometimes I felt as if the choices didn't quite contain options that would accurately descibe how I would handle the situation, but other than that it was grand.

author: {'steamid': '76561198066843051', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 589, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 589, 'last_played': 1420415050}
review: Wow! Just... Wow! I am only on chapter two and already I sit here absolutly floored by what is going on in this story. I think i will continue the path of philosiphy.

author: {'steamid': '76561198081868742', 'num_games_owned': 479, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 391, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 170, 'last_played': 1642152263}
review: This is an awesome game. The story is very touching, and there are so many choices. It was actually difficult trying to decide which path i wanted to travel down.

author: {'steamid': '76561198092436056', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 320, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 248, 'last_played': 1451360433}
review:
1.Impressions
This game is somthing of an oddity on steam, it being more of a book than a game. Atleast thats what I thought it would be. However, robots and sci-fi attracts me so I bought it. I would regret this soon afterword as I spent hours playing the game. I've been so interested in a CYOA
2.Gameplay
Most people complain about the odd details forced into the story and simple writing but it isn't supposed to be a book. Its a game, as stated earlier I thought it WAS a book but it isn't. It is a full-fleged game. The writing isn't supposed to be wonderful. Also, those odd details are there because they are a result of choosing your own Adventure. And they pop up later.
3.What I did
-Took over Alaska
-Killed a women
-Built a robot-tounge
-Got my arm blown off by a terrorist and replaced it with a gun
-AND replaced part of my brain with a computer
4.Conclusion
Get the game

author: {'steamid': '76561197999670561', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 501, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 333, 'last_played': 1421150700}
review:
My god. One of the best experiences I've had ever, storywise that is. There were so many things to choose from, and so many consequences. Like, if you did this, than this happened, but if you didn't do the first this, the second thing would never happen.

11/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198013581553', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 1067, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 265, 'last_played': 1570583547}

review: My brother and I started this game at the same time, I created a robot that looked like a human and felt emotions and together we explored the moral ideas concerning robot rights and the future of robotics. He created a gigantic war machine and had to stop a robot uprising from destroying the world. 10/10 best $5 dollars I've spent on a game in a long time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198077981990', 'num_games_owned': 233, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 483, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 293, 'last_played': 1490989522}

author: {'steamid': '76561198052237207', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 241, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 241, 'last_played': 1420240517}

author: {'steamid': '76561197999794617', 'num_games_owned': 131, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 314, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 314, 'last_played': 1420228298}
review:
This was my first text based game and CYOA and I wasn't quite sure what to expect. After a few play throughs I can say I am impressed and am thoroughly enjoying Choice of Robots. Do you want to be the destroyer of worlds? lover of your creations? savior of the world? Or hated by all? 

I would like to say there are a couple of typos that i've noticed. The game also seems almost to basic with no real save functionality. Something I would like them to add along with a back button. But in its current state I give it a 8.5/10 and was a great value when I bought it ($3)

author: {'steamid': '76561198015327956', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 239, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 110, 'last_played': 1422089328}

author: {'steamid': '76561198152223285', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 300, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 297, 'last_played': 1425964570}
review: Good text based game that I enjoyed but hoped it would be longer, would reccomend to get sale because $5 is a bit much for this game

author: {'steamid': '76561198131847792', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 930, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 394, 'last_played': 1428655283}
review:
As a gamer who usually plays games with fancy graphics, I didn't quite expect myself to try out a game like this. I had several games from several different categories, and i never thought of playing an interactive novel before. During the holiday season, i noticed this game, oddly titled Choice of robots, but it was really cheap, and had good reviews, so i picked it up. Maybe it was my nostalgia towards books, or maybe my curiosity for something different, but i did find myself pleasantly surprised by this text based adventure. It touched my heart in a way no other game has done before, and made me learn something about myself, even things i didn't even think would in me. It showed me flaws in myself, and generally actually did make me a better person. 

I highly reccomend this game, as it seems like it has a bit for everyone, and it has the potential to really learn about our true selves.

10/10, amazing story

author: {'steamid': '76561198035243217', 'num_games_owned': 1326, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 634, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 559, 'last_played': 1422989630}
review:
If you like Choose Your Own Adventure books, this is well worth checking out. It takes the experience of CYOA and keeps you from "cheating" through the story (you know what I mean, who hasn't checked out what the answers are to the various choices before committing?). I know that the other game I got from this publisher was based on the fantasy world they created in a regular book trilogy, so I will to see if Kevin Gold has his own set of books worth reading. 

Be warned, this is a text-based adventure game. There are no flashy graphics - there is reading and a lot of choices.

author: {'steamid': '76561198040957354', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 163, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 163, 'last_played': 1420168376}
review: A fun text-based game that gives you a lot of options and freedom.

author: {'steamid': '76561198039663090', 'num_games_owned': 494, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 432, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 224, 'last_played': 1483939371}
review: Probably the best game I've played from, 'Choice of Games'. Now, I've only played four of their games, but I don't know if they could ever top this game. The ideas presented on robotics, humanity, and their future combination has been said before, but the story sucks you in just enough to make every choice seem real. That is if you're actually paying attention to the story at hand. I've played through it several times, and I have to say that my favorite features are in the chooseable beginnings, the shaping of your first robot, and in the dilemma's presented in wanting to make something more human or something completely machine. I don't want to go anymore into it for fear of spoiling something, but I have to say that this is a great buy.

author: {'steamid': '76561197977063483', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 59, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 59, 'last_played': 1420175466}
review:
I didn't expect that very first choice to have the impact it did, but it did.

I've been fond of CoG's listing of interactive novels ever since I found the Heroes Rise set, which was a wonderful three parter. Then it was Mecha Ace, and now Choice of Robots.

You affect the world, you affect everything around you with the choices you make. Is your robot going to be a soulless military machine? An emotional believer in robot-human rights? Or something else in between? Will you hate all the humans and assume they're exploiting you, or work with one or two and see where the road takes you?

It's a long road, and there are so many ways for it to end.

"Happy birthday, to you..."

author: {'steamid': '76561197983722008', 'num_games_owned': 642, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 190, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 174, 'last_played': 1512761072}
review:
Чудесная игра о слишком умном и человечном человеке и его роботе. Одна из лучших интерактивных новелл, в которые я играл.

9/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197960654374', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 203, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 203, 'last_played': 1420137206}
review: Lovely piece of storytelling. Also, robots.

author: {'steamid': '76561197966366729', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 2494, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 969, 'last_played': 1422647184}
review:
I would recommend this game to anyone that loves Robots and technology as much as I do. Here is a good example of how much that is, I fell in love and married my robot in this game.

You don't get too many options to start with but as the game progresses you can upgrade (carefully) the important parts (to you, and your situation) of your robot(s). I did create two robots with love in mind, but it wasn't until the second one that I was able to carry out this passion. A few of the choices I had to pick from didn't sound much like me, and I picked the "best possible of the worse case" scenario.

I can honestly say that I loved and hated this game, as it should be for an emotional response to anything. I also love choice your own adventure books. I picked up a number of different games made by this same person, and i'm now more excited to play them next. Superheroes!

P.S. I love, robot love.

author: {'steamid': '76561198167250179', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 74, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 74, 'last_played': 1420112125}
review: Text-only choose-your-own-adventure type game. Nothing revolutionary for a robot story, but very enjoyable. Will probably replay to see in what other directions I can take the world... :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198027621353', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 227, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 227, 'last_played': 1420246710}

author: {'steamid': '76561198090915263', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 3709, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1233, 'last_played': 1670887153}
review:
"Choice of Robots" is, in my opinion, a fantastic interactive experience. The story is superb, the possibilities are vast, the choice of words is amazing...



...And I got to fight crime with a chainmail-wearing vigilante.

author: {'steamid': '76561198048007060', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1188, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 183, 'last_played': 1529459031}
review: This is one of the if not the best choice of games to be released to date it is right next to choice of the deathless. It combines some ideas from sifi while also showing your rise in the corprate ladders to either aa mega company or just outright failling.

author: {'steamid': '76561197960465628', 'num_games_owned': 665, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 32, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 32, 'last_played': 1420002732}
review:
I was really excited to try this game out, so I grabbed it while it was on sale. If I could give it a neutral rating rather than a negative, I would. 

I didn't get too far into it before I had to stop. The writing, for lack of a better phrase, tries too hard. It's written like a fan-fiction, with oddly specific details that detract from otherwise good writing. For example, at one point you get a phone call and have to pick if it's the CEO of a startup calling you or if it's your manga artist friend. The point at which I decided to stop was when a hip young reporter ordered a PBR. There's just so many things that feel unnaturally forced into the story. 

I think it has a lot of potential, but it's a little rough around the edges for now.

author: {'steamid': '76561198075439476', 'num_games_owned': 124, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 740, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 360, 'last_played': 1468441489}

author: {'steamid': '76561198080781507', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 262, 'playtime_forever': 159, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 159, 'last_played': 1420137142}
review: Once more, a pretty good game, now, there are so many options still left to be pursued that I am definitely tempted to play it again, and again and once more probably. If anyone is interested in a game of this type, this is a must buy.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030586237', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 79, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 79, 'last_played': 1420046928}
review:
For a simple text-based game/interactive novel, Choice of Robots is very likeable with many possible branches. Starting with a strange dream leading to the creation of your robot, you can end up anywhere from building robots capable of love and marrying one yourself to leading a revolution against humans with your robot army/comrades.

My only two wishes are being able to save and reload to certain points, though it might ruin the experience - and being able to change certain aspects of my robots design later on or having more than one model. (e.g. placing a gun on my Robot to appease Ziegler then after graduating remove it to keep my robot elegant).

(It says I haven't played it much, but that's because I did so offline...)

author: {'steamid': '76561198074009245', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 705, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 222, 'last_played': 1455833598}
review:
Definitely for people who are more into c.y.o.a. games and books. I'm finding it very enjoyable and, surprisingly, it's been really easy to create a new protagonist in my head with each replay (despite there being a limited number of choices and repeated events and scenarios). 

Worth checking out if you're into robots and storytelling!

author: {'steamid': '76561198071803164', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 118, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 109, 'last_played': 1557808631}
review: I laughed, I cried, I loved my little robot to death. This game put me through something that I cant even explain. This game, although unconventional in its gameplay is easliy my game of the year, this late into the season.

author: {'steamid': '76561198087340707', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 212, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 91, 'last_played': 1426214380}
review: I've always had a soft spot for choice of games, they mix my love of reading with gaming and have huge replayability.  As far as this particular game goes, i like how it adds a bit of flavor on later playthroughs by breaking the 4th wall through hints.

author: {'steamid': '76561198026998497', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 504, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 202, 'last_played': 1420065236}
review: Taking the Empathy route in the path where you teach a robot to love was heart-wrenching.

author: {'steamid': '76561198065624488', 'num_games_owned': 525, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 294, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 294, 'last_played': 1420003677}
review:
Tons of lifes. Tons of endings. I really enjoyed this game, and I hardly find games I enjoy these days - Even fewer text-based games!
I usually hate text-based games, but this was by far the best one I have even played. It's cheap, so give it a go!

author: {'steamid': '76561198077440956', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 412, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 412, 'last_played': 1420067450}
review: Worth more than the money I payed for it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027098930', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 406, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 406, 'last_played': 1419783862}
review:
Este juego te da la oportunidad de crear una aventura única sobre el futuro y los robots.
Cada vez que empieces la historia aprenderás las consecuencias de tus acciones de una forma que ningún juego ha sido capaz de conseguir. En más de un momento dudarás de que decisión tomar, porque una vez hayas decidido algo no hay vuelta atrás a menos que quieras repetir desde 0 toda la historia.
Hay muchísimas posibilidades y la rejugabilidad es muy alta.
Cada historia dura entre 2 y 4 horas, el juego se guarda automáticamente tras cada toma de decisión y la narración es muy entretenida.
